Reviews.Title: “Fantastico!”
Reviews.Author: magfox
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a stopover in Barcelona. It was perfect for us. A lovely big bedroom with a balcony, good shower and great breakfast. The location is fantastic as the street is quiet but near to a wide selection of very lively bars and restaurants. It is also five minutes from the aircoach which is perfect for early morning flights. Will definitely stay in this hotel on next trip to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, perfect price!”
Reviews.Author: Esther G
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights of our honeymoon here. It is located in a quiet alley way, yet two blocks away from La Rambla (food, shops, etc.). Also near the bus stop (great way to get to and from airport) and metro. Room was clean and modern. Nothing luxurious but met our needs for great location in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Central location stylish bedroom good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: JMM61055
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel met our expectations with simple stylish decor, good power shower and delicious breakfast. Good storage space, large screen TV and iPod dock. It suited us as it was central and very quiet for its location. Breakfast included an excellent coffee machine, wide selection of fruit, delicious fresh croissants and was included in the price. The staff were smile and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “denit hotel: not value for money”
Reviews.Author: Nick K
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the hotel for 3 days and unfortunately It was a disappointment. Yes, the hotel is adequate clean and centrally located. But I payed almost 200 euros/day in order to book a "business" room. The room was more like a corridor, the sheets were not comfortable and there was no fridge (!) inside the room. Moreover, the bed was not double (two single bed collided). Also, the breakfast is so basic that they did not had even eggs! If I had to pay 70-80 euros then I would say it's a fair fee. But for 200 euros definitely I felt I was robbed. So, my overall approach to the hotel for the money I spent it was bad.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: garethellis36
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights while exploring the city and it was a great base for our trip. The hotel is/was clean and modern and was generally quiet enough for us to sleep. The only negatives we would mention are the size of the room (we had the smallest/cheapest one available), which barely gave us space to put our suitcases on the floor, the bathroom (basically a toilet and a shower "wet room" behind a sliding door - felt like you were taking a dump in a wardrobe) and the breakfasts, which were a bit limp and uninspiring. On the whole, good value and we would stay here again - although I think we would go for a bigger room!

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to be!”
Reviews.Author: Nasia_D
Reviews.Content: Denit is definately not spacious, luxurious or romantic. However, it is extremely well located (walking distance to the major attractions), very clean and quiet, modern and cleverly designed, with helpful staff and decent breakfast. For us, with an 18-month-old baby, was very convenient, since we could easily walk all around the city center and not have to worry about how to start the day or about the room condition or about the weather (big umbrellas are provided at the hotel reception). I would recommend to people who want to explore Barcellona, but not to those who prefer to spend lots of time at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: travelerBobDc
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. It's only about a block from Placa Catalunya where you can get Aerobus to and from the airport. And it's right near the top of the Gothic Quarter with loads of shops, cafes, all the action. Yet it is on a quiet street. Room I had was small but nice and new feeling. Continental breakfast spread was very nice (I understand you may have to book directly with the hotel to get the breakfast - not sure if this is true but it is what I did.) Great location, quiet street, beautiful room but small, nice breakfast. Hard to beat. I would stay here again if I ever get the opportunity to return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice friendly Hotel, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: Reinhard76
Reviews.Content: Hotel is 3 minutes walk away from Pl Catalunya, where the AeroBus arrives from Airport and which also is a stop for both Hop On Hop Off bus lines. Many of our explorations were on foot and most central areas are within good reach (Born, Gothic, Ramblas, Sea Front). We had room 12 (XL) at first floor which looks out to the front (Carrer d'Estruc). Room was very nice, not huge in absolute terms but easily large enough for two people, very clean and quiet. Room had free WIFI and an iPhone docking station (nice). There's no mini bar in the room but Reception desk are selling water, juice etc. There's a computer with printer available for use at the reception (no extra cost), which is good enough for online check in and printing boarding passes. Overall very pleasant stay at the DENIT.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Denit April 2012”
Reviews.Author: Sheri N
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent 6 nights at the Hotel Denit in April 2012. We chose the hotel based on the reviews on TripAdvisor. The Hotel Denit was ideal. The location was perfect; steps from the Plaza Cataluyna and steps from La Rambla. The Aerobus to the airport was convenient - right at the Plaza Cataluyna. We reserved the XL room but is was actually bigger than we needed. Teh room was spotless; the shower area was adequate. In fact, the shower was wonderful. The bed is a platform bed. I did miss the box springs and my back was a bit sore from lack thereof. The staff was terrific. They spoke excellent English. They gave me detailed directions on how to take the train to Montserrat. I would stay at the Hotel Denit again and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Gluten-free friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: kjh555
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great in every way. It's an easy walk from the Aerobus stop at Placa de Catalunya, and convenient for most of the major sites in the city. We booked a "large" room including breakfast and it was spacious and modern. I had emailed ahead indicating that I was gluten intolerant and asked about gfree options at breakfast. The manager replied to my email and said it would not be a problem and asked me what I liked to eat at breakfast! The first morning at breakfast I asked the gal in charge of the breakfast room what might be safe for me to eat and she knew my room number & immediately led me to her "kitchen" and showed me a bag of gluten free muffins, a large bag of gfree cereal, and a loaf of gfree bread, all just for me. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful, in fact, our last morning, 3/29/12, was the day of the National strike in Spain and we had a morning flight. We had heard the day before from a taxi driver that many taxis would not be working and the buses and other mass transit would be spotty. The hotel assured us that they would have a taxi waiting for us and because the breakfast room was not open that day they brought up my gfree stash and served a breakfast for my husband and myself in the lobby before our pick up time. I cannot praise the Denit's staff enough. They truly went above and beyond.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Denit”
Reviews.Author: Ian10762
Reviews.Content: This was a great find. It's in a small lane no more than 200 meters from the place de catalunya (Perfect for the airport bus 2 mins walk max) yet still very quiet on a night. It's quite small, very modern, stylish and spotlessly clean. Very friendly and helpfull staff. We were there during the General strike and the staff couldn't have done more to help people with flight and transport queries. Excellent we have been to Barclona twice and both times have had very good hotels but this is the one we will return to next time.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet place in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ZoeGi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only a minute walk from Plaza de Catalunya but it was very quiet at night even during the weekend. All the staff we dealt with spoke good English. Room was simple and comfy. The hotel is trendy, modern and clean. Breakfast is basic and is about 6€ per person. Again, great location, very central and practical to visit Barcelona attractions and wander in the little streets in the Gothic Quarter. I would recommend this place without a doubt for a Couples or Friends weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price, nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_traveladdicts
Reviews.Content: The location was easy to find and very central to Barcelona's Las Ramblas. Good price and quality of hotel considering you will probably be out exploring all the nearby sites.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent modern boutiqure hotel”
Reviews.Author: lifeandsoul
Reviews.Content: If you like your hotels modern and functional you will like Denit. White is the predominant colour and it is slightly unconventional. The arrangements with the bathroom and frost glass doors does mean it is the sort of place you would go with someone that you know well. Breakfast is fairly basic, but its price and location are absolutely outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Great locaton!”
Reviews.Author: tulip24_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location so near to the bus stop and central also for the hop on off bus which is great way to get around and see all. If your lucky enough to get a girl called Anna at reception shes so helpful easy to ask her any questions especially if its your first time in Barcelona. Rooms are clean and ideal if your just there to go sightseen. Breakfast fine would be nice if they had more freash fruit. I certainly would stay here again convient to everything and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Near Placa de Catalunya”
Reviews.Author: Kent R
Reviews.Content: Nice small, clean, modern, quiet, functional hotel in a great location. About a 3/4 a block away from the Eurobus stop at Placa de Catalunya. They have 1 computer in the lobby to use. Good continental breakfast option. I would definitely go back and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in the heart of Barri Gotic”
Reviews.Author: Guy_PerthAus
Reviews.Content: It's best to go into this hotel with your expectations set to correspond with the price of the room. The hotel is centrally located in a slightly seedy alleyway, close to the metro, La Rambla and the Barri Gotic. The room was small but modern, neat, warm and generally clean.  The bathroom consisted of a toilet and bath/shower combo, with the single sink located in the bedroom itself behind a roller blind. The staff were helpful when asked, but didn't really volunteer any information when we arrived. A €6 breakfast is offered but was fairly basic.  In terms of the downsides, the wifi was slow, unpredictable and bounced us off all time time, requiring us to log back in through a tedious username and password system. The view out the window was on to someone's balcony and washing line, so don't expect any sweeping street views. The shower randomly sprayed either freezing cold or scalding hot water despite the setting remaining in the same position. The bathroom had the smell of a Spanish drain, which we encountered in other hotels in Spain, but didn't get any more inviting with each experience. There was no fridge in the room, or even a few tissues.  The glass sliding door between the living area and the bathroom offered little privacy and you'll get to know your travelling companion very, very well.  Overall, the hotel had more of a feel of an upmarket pensione than a hotel.  All in all, we got what we paid for (€120 per night) but, at the same time, thought we were going to get a bit more and had been surprised by the low price when we were booking.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: PHN1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Denit with our 1 year old. The room was stylishly decorated, in scandinavian style. We had a room in the back of the hotel, facing tiny courtyard. So no view, but at least some natural light. The bed was large and comfy and our daughter had a baby cot, which fitted very well into the room. The room was not the standard, but the slightly larger one (can't recall the name) and even after having the large bed + cot, it still contained plenty of space. Only the bathroom was tiny. The breakfast was nice, not super large buffet as in Northern Europe, but definitely enough to get you started. I think on Sunday it was slightly smaller than on other days. Maybe they did not get full variety on Sunday from the bakery? The front desk was always friendly and helpful. What we loved the most, was the close proximity to Plaza Catalunia, only 1/2 a block away. It was great location as we spent the days walking around to see the sights, shopping etc. With the baby stroller, we did not try the underground, but instead used the taxi for longer journeys. We arrived late in the evening with the airport bus and I was a little worried about the pickpockets etc having to manage our luggage + baby in a stroller from the Plaza to the hotel. No problems at all. Just take reasonable care of your belongings as in any other big city. All in all, this was definitely one of the best all round hotel experiences ever!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Eyalp7
Reviews.Content: I stayed on the hotel on 2-6 February 2012. The location was perfect. Although you enter the hotel through a strange alley, it is near the Plaza Catalunya. The hotel is pretty small, the rooms are fine (one room with bathroom in it) - the odd thing is that there is no separate bathroom (you can watch the photos on their website) The Breakfast was a bit missing- 2-3 kinds of bread (wasn't that good), some cheese and etc. there were no eggs. For Wi-Fi you have to ask the receptionist to give you password and username and it's pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: katerina_bouloumpasi
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is situated in the heart of Barcelona- but at the same time far from the hustle and bustle. Our room (no 51) was great! It had great modern- minimal decoration, the bed was huge with high quality bed linen, the bathroom big enough and very clean and the terrace really big and convenient. The wi- fi was high speed and the hotel had also common pc and printer at the lobby. The disadvantages were the poor breakfast and the lack of a small fridge in the room (Barcelona is hot during summer!). I highly recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel near Place Catalunya and Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: Lilamari
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel for a few days... friendly and helpfull staff, good breakfast and very clean rooms. Good shower... we had a room on the front side of the hotel in a very quit street amazing that you are nearly on Place Catalunya and the Ramblas and that its so quiet!! I would like to recommend this hotel for guest who wants to stay for a few days... a week is to long because the rooms are small and the breakfast is the same every day!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and friendly hotel near bustling Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: HBCAtravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an easy walk for our family from the metro even with suitcases. Once inside the hotel, it is a very modern and clean place. We wondered what we were getting into when we turned onto the small street, but it was perfect for providing quiet nights of sleep. The staff were all very friendly and accommodating and made the entire family feel very welcome. Breakfast had options for adults and children. The only drawback was that the free internet required multiple codes that had to be updated frequently. We would definitely stay again if we could return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-Denit”
Reviews.Author: EralpJabbour
Reviews.Content: Great location, very helpful staff, very clean & modern room. We enjoyed our stay a lot, we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay with some mishaps”
Reviews.Author: TravelBeforeKids
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in December. The pros: 1) Great location - right at the start of La Ramblas. Easy to find from tourist hut where shuttle from airport dropped us off. 2) Good (if monotous) spread for breakfast - you wont leave hungry 3) Friendly staff The cons: 1) Clueless girl who checked us in. Did not know how long we were staying, did not know that breakfast was included, did not know where things were around. 2) Interent being almost unusable despite being factored in the price. Others have commented on it. 3) No coffee maker in room. No glasses in room. Available from front desk. Coffee costs one euro each at front desk. What is the point of having a nice balcony if you can't sit out on it and relax with a cup of coffee ? 4) design of the bathroom and the sink being completely seperate and inside the room. So if you go to the bathroom in the middle of the night and have to wash your hands, you have to stand next to the bed and wake up everyone as you run water. 5) Airconditioning did not work. It was very warm even in december and we wanted the air on. It did not work, had to sleep with the window open which did not have any screen so there were some insects that got inside. 6) Rooms close together so when the couple with the crying kids checked out at 5 AM, we heard *every* *single* *word* they spoke as they were leaving. Look, the location was great. We got the biggest room they have and service when we asked for it was prompt. I would recommend it for first time visitors to Barcelona so they can get their bearings specially if you can get it for a good price. We will probably stay elsewhere on our next visit but would still recommend this place to those looking for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Only spent 1 hour here!”
Reviews.Author: chad2001
Reviews.Content: We originally booked this hotel but subsequently moved to one of its sister hotels, the wonderful Majestic Hotel. (If you are offerred this move for the same price, please take it). We booked hotel Denit during a busy convention week in Barcelona and the price for an Economy Plus room was an outrageous 189 EUR per night, but it was the "best" deal we could find nevertheless. Anyway, when we showed up, we were given what appeared to be an Economy room which was more like a "match box". We were a couple and there was no way we could stay in that room for 4 nights, there wasn't enough room to even lay our two suitcases down on the floor. The hotel is nice and clean, and location is terrific but that room was so tiny. (When you sit on the toilet, the bed would be less than 5 feet directly in front of you with no door separating!) Also the tiny lane in front of the hotel had a bad sewage / urine smell, so bad that we had to hold our breath walking down that lane. Anyway, I complained to the front desk that it was not the room type I had booked. Kudos to the lady at the front desk on that day, she acknowledged it, and offered to move us to Hotel Majestic (see my separate review) for the first 2 nights until the room type we had booked became available. I hesitated at first because Hotel Majestic location is about 10-15 mins walk away from Plaza Catalunya, but I could not stay in the match box and did not want to unpack/pack. I checked out Majestic Hotel online, and after being assured that it would be a better choice, I asked if we could stay at the MH for the entire 4-day stay. It was our luck that there was a room available so they paid for a taxi to take us to our upgraded hotel. While I appreciate what Hotel Denit has done in this situation, we would have had a miserable time at Hotel Denit if we didn't speak up. They need to somehow work with their neighbors or the city on that horrible smell on the tiny lane their hotel is situated. When booking hotel Denit, as a single you might be okay. But for couples, don't even think of booking anything lower than their most expensive, biggest room. Even that, you should ask for the size of the room before you book. I know their smallest room type is almost literally a "match box"!

Reviews.Title: “SHORT TRIP”
Reviews.Author: SUSAN M
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, room cleaned daily, staff service was impeccable. Used internet in hotel lobby without any problems checking my E mails and being able to print documents should I have so required. No noise from surrounding street although the city was busy due to Christmas shoppers and revellers.Would strongly recommend this hotel to friends and colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “1 block from las ramblas, amazing value”
Reviews.Author: gsmason
Reviews.Content: 1 block from las ramblas, near placa catalanya, 88 euros including taxes and breakfast for 2, wonderful value, small and efficient rooms, typical guest is well dressed european in 20s and 30s. good breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: sharon2468
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a modern design, good breakfast and excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location plus great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Bradlakis
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for sights, shops and restaurants all within easy walking distance, the room are clean and cleverly designed plus the staff are sincerely warm and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Khao-I-Dang8081
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located an easy walk from the Ramblas, Gothic Quarter, the Catalunya metro stop and a host of other Barcelona attractions. It is also a block and a half from the Aerobus, a very convenient and affordable (5.30 Euro) ride to and from the airport. The staff was consistently friendly and helpful, from the people at the front desk to the housekeeping personnel. The person who attended to our room (Marina) became my 9 year-old daughter's penpal for the last few days of our stay, leaving her notes and cookies in response to notes left for her. We also enjoyed the breakfast mentioned by a number of the other reviewers.

Reviews.Title: “modern,minimal-design hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: alwaysexcessbaggage
Reviews.Content: we chose this hotel mainly because of the location and i am glad we were right. we stayed for eight days in october end. it is very conveniently situated just five minutes away from plaza catalunya and yet is really quiet and peaceful once you get in. it is on a narrow side street which is just off plaza catalunya.very convenient to walk to barri gotic,passeig de gracia,la rambla etc. catalunya metro station is just five minutes away. .the hotel is done in contemporary,minimal style but still manages to make you feel comfortable and cozy.rooms are smallish but well designed.the breakfast which was included in the price is basic.breakfast room is in the basement ,which in some hotels ends up looking gloomy.however,here the space is cheerful and done in just whites..enjoyed our first cups of coffee here everyday! the front desk staff was pleasant and always very helpful. when we wanted to go to places off-the-beaten-path and asked for guidance, they would help with information and even print-out maps for us! really professional and courteous staff. the only downside is that there is no view from the windows.you are in the heart of barcelona but there is no glimpse of it even.. overall, it is a great place as a base to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and very central”
Reviews.Author: GrandTourer2
Reviews.Content: Although the entrance is tucked away in a side street this hotel is very centrally located. The accommodation is very modern and clean and despite its position we heard no noises on the 2 nights we stayed there in November. Breakfast was quite good and the staff pleasant and attentive and the cost very reasonable for the location which is an easy walk from where the Airport shuttle bus terminates. Certainly Barcelona is on our list of cities we would like to visit again and we would certainly stay at Hotel Denit.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Pepsi888
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location :) very convenient, quiet street, no noise from street. Clean room a bit small but good if you are not planning to spend a lot time in, good breakfast. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “in the heart of BCN and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Burkhard B
Reviews.Content: A great location in the northern part of Barri Gotic ... but anyway quiet nights to relax from sightseeing and nightlife. Pretty nice, modern rooms including LCD-TV, W-Lan and iPod/iPhone docking station. Breakfast was better than expected until (exactly!!!) 11 a.m. at weekend. We will come back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff, Felt at home”
Reviews.Author: enon h
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Denit hotel last week for 5 nights with our baby boy. we took the Business room that was quiet big, and we also had a large balcony which was very nice. When we came to the hotel we were disappointed to know that there is no kettle in the room for our baby. The hotel staff (amazing !!!!! ) called some different hotels and when we came back from a tour in the city we received the kettle for our stay. we also had an issue with the crib that didn't have a head protector. We were shocked that they went and bought it specially for us. The staff is amazing, the hotel is so friendly and we really felt like at home. The breakfast was really nice and the dinning room is pleasent and calming like the hotel it self. We had alot of question to the staff regarding Barcelona and the resturants in the area and they were always so kind to help us. of course and the most important thing is the great location, 20 sec. from placa catalunya in an amazing alley. we really recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Central Location”
Reviews.Author: oldgang598
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel at the beginning of November, we were there for a city break. The hotel was clean and welcoming, the reception staff were pleasant and helpful answering questions about Barcelona. The room was pleasant, the double bed was actually two singles pushed together, but that was not an issue. There was no view from the window as we faced the inner courtyard, no problem, and the room was quiet. Breakfast was the normal continental breakfast, there was plenty of choice and the breakfast room was quite large considering the hotel only has 44 rooms. Breakfast here was certainly better than some offering we have had elsewhere. The location of the hotel was great, it was only a short walk from the Airport bus stop and close to metro. It is located in the old town close to the cathedral and a short walk from La Rambla. We would certainly use this hotel again if we were to visit Barcelona again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A nice gem in the heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: GRtraveler26
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Denit for three nights in early November. We really enjoyed this contemporary boutique hotel. It is on a small side street very close to Los Ramblas and Playa Cataluyna, so an excellent location, and good value for the money. Loved the decor and contemporarly feel. Newer hotel. Excellent bed, very quiet, despite being so close to all of the action. Had a hard time keeping water from dribbling out of the shower area into the rest of the bathroom, but that was pretty minor. The breakfast was OK, but we decided to do breakfast elsewhere the other two mornings. Plenty of options. We would definitely stay here again. Great location, good value, clean and felt very safe. The woman at the front desk was so helpful as well. She helped us order tickets for the LaSagrada Familia and print them out right in the lobby. Very friendly with good service!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bright light in the Barri Gotic”
Reviews.Author: Holly M
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for 3 nights and highly recommend this bright little hotel in the midst of the Barri Gotic. Clean, compact room (perfectly fine for collapsing into at the end of a busy day), super friendly staff, perfect location. The Estruc street is dark (more like what I'd call an alley), and it's a quiet oasis just steps from the Ramblas and busy parts of the Old City. Near Plaza de Catalunya. On Estruc is a luggage storage center and a bike rental place. Casa Batllo (Gaudi) is just 5 blocks north on the Passeig de Gracia. The Corte Ingles department store is also just 1 block north. I usully ventured south into the Gothic Quarter and the cathedral, Santa Maria del Pi, and other attractions were very close. Of course, any hotel in the Gothic Quarter is close to everything, but Hotel Denit is recommended due to its quiet--really welcoming at the end of a hard day of walking. Breakfast is fine. Bed comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Dana B
Reviews.Content: Hotel Denit was recommended to me by a colleague who had stayed there during her travels to Barcelona. I was very glad I followed her recommendation and booked a several night stay at the hotel. It is tucked away in one of the most central, busy and bustling parts of the city making it a perfect location for vacationing travelers. Though in the heart of the city, the hotel was very quiet at night, and I never was disturbed by noise from the outside or other guests. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. They made my stay a wonderful experience. The hotel is quite clean and well-maintained and economical.

Reviews.Title: “Light and friendly”
Reviews.Author: SiwJ
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for 4 nights. The staff was friendly, the room light, tidy and clean. The hotel is located close to the ariport bus, the old town and la Rambla. This made coming and leaving town a smooth process, and we was able to explore la Rambla, Barri Ghotic, the harbour and el Raval og Eixample by foot - our favourite way of discoveing a city.

Reviews.Title: “A great find!”
Reviews.Author: jafran
Reviews.Content: I found Hotel Denit when the place I usually stay at was closed for renovation. I am so pleased because it turned out to be fabulous and very very reasonable. Its all white minimalist decor was very cool and peaceful in a hot city and the staff were wonderful, always ready and willing to help. Our room was a reasonable size for the price and also quiet and extremely clean. Breakfasts were well provisioned with a variety of meats, cheeses etc and a lot of choice. Just a few minutes from the airport bus drop in Placa Catalunya. The street is very narrow withbollards at the top so there is no traffic and therefore little noise at night. There was an abundance of literature for guests to use and a lovely little Vinoteca, or wine shop and bar called Palador just across from the hotel. It was a pleasant way to start the evening with a glass of wine and small tapas of cheese or meat for just 3 euro. I will certainly stay there again and would be perfectly happy on my own.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and friendly small hotel!”
Reviews.Author: gail b
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights recently, and were so glad we had chosen this place. The location was unbeatable; so very close to the Ramblas, and the airport bus stop, and yet in a quiet, hidden away side-street. The only criticism we have is that our room smelt overwhelmingly of smoke; not nice! The front desk said they couldn't swap us to another room as they were full (not surprisingly), so they gave us some spray to use (it didn't work). Apart from that, this modern/minimalist Hotel was great. Breakfast was very good, our shower was good, the air-conditioner worked well, the room isn't big, but very comfortable nonetheless. The little girl on the desk was friendly and helpful with maps, restaurants, etc. We would stay here again because of the brilliant location and very reasonable cost.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Denit - Very central, welcoming and modern”
Reviews.Author: roodle
Reviews.Content: We LOVED our stay at this hotel. We travelled as a group of two couple (one with a baby) and as such were looking for a central hotel to provide a good location for popping back to during the day and for travel in and out of town. Not only did Hotel Denit provide this at a good rate, it exceeded expectations with great staff, a good breakfast and great rooms - The hotel also provided a cot for our baby, complete with lovely cartoon bedding (taking the time to place the baby's toys in the newly made cot each day too). Although there was some noise from the other guests at times, at no point did this wake our 5 month old or keep us from resting (I have stayed in five star hotels with MUCH worse noise problems). The breakfast was good quality and the other guests surprisingly friendly and pleasant! As mentioned, the location was great for getting around and about and made a great base for our city break. I would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Denit, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Ness46
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many small hotels in europe and I would class this one amongst the best for convenience, some of the best hotels can be found down small side streets. We upgraded to a bigger room which had a great rainshower, and ideally for us the sink and mirror were outside of the shower/toilet area, this meant one of you can still use the sink, shave etc whilst the other showers. The receptionist was very help, giving us directions for best shopping and the tube stations. In easy reach of the "high class" shops such as Tiffany's but also close to the markets which were good value for money. If you like walking the beach is not too far but we decided to go by tube to the Olympic village then walked down to the beach and all the way along the beach side back to the marina. One thing that let the hotel down, on the monday morning, a change of staff in the breakfast area, by the time we were half way through breakfast we were surrounded by tables full of leftovers, nothing was cleared away, new guest were arriving for breakfast to be greeted by tables full of dirty plates and no where to sit with most of the food station empty. This was in total contrast to previous mornings where everything was being cleared and replaced non stop, so could have been a one off?

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff but a little "sterile"”
Reviews.Author: Glenn R
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to Las Ramblas and great for the Airport bus to or from Barcelona. We a a "business" room that was larger than the standard room. The room were very clean and everything worked however I have to stay I found the surroundings lacked any warmth with lots of white melamine everywhere it felt very sterile. Would I stay here again, yes, although it was a little expensive but were were on holiday and as long as it is clean and the location is good then the main points are satisfied....Hotel Denit did this. Oh breakfast was Ok, probably slightly better then average for a European Hotel, with the usualy cereals, fruit, toast pastries etc.

Reviews.Title: “Big Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: dcrec
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of the good reviews it received on Trip Advisor and the price. Unfortunately, we were very disappointed with the actual stay. As the saying goes, you get what you pay for! The hotel is basically one step above a hostel. Although we requested a quiet, non-smoking room, we were given a room right off the lobby, (literally just a few feet away from the front desk) and even with our door closed, we could hear the conversations there. We asked to be switched to a quieter room and were told the only option was a "down grade." We took it, even though it smelled like smoke (it's supposedly a non-smoking hotel), was barely large enough to move, and was lacking any natural light. We were also told that we would not be credited for the difference in room category/price. Once we got into the room and began to unpack, we noticed the hair ball in the shower and the dirt and hair elsewhere in the room. Additionally, we asked for extra pillows but were told that we couldn't have any because each room only got two. When we explained that I had a bad back and needed the extra support, we were given a few bed decorative pillows which were also filthy. Thank goodness we had only booked the room for one night. I couldn't wait to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Great charming boutique hotel in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: abhaysanan
Reviews.Content: I had read a lot of good reviews about Hotel Denit especially it's location and they all turned out to be pretty spot on. Pros: - Easily accessible from Airport and very close to all transportation. My wife and I took the bus to Catalunya and walked to the hotel in a matter of few mins. - Hotel is located towards the end of the Gothic Quarter which is a great part of Barcelona especially if you like the stone path feel and small shops/restaurants. - Decent amenities with great air conditioning and a free breakfast included. - Some people based on reviews seemed to have trouble with the wifi but we had no issues. - Great service staff. They were helpful and gave us good restaurant recommendations as well. Cons: - You'll probably read this a lot but their most basic room called the Economy (single/double) room is pretty small. My wife and I were traveling for a week and with our 2 big suitcases, hardly had any space. - Another thing that may annoy some people is the shower area in the bathroom which isn't isolated completely from the rest of the restroom which means wet floors everywhere. All in all, we really liked the hotel. The breakfast was decent enough that we ate here almost everyday before heading out. It was simple - breads, muffins, cereals, fruits, croissants, coffee - nothing too fancy but definitely sufficient. We were able to upgrade our room to the Economy Plus room once there was availability which was way better in terms of space. The design is modern and funky - we liked that the sink was within the closet - something unique and different. The location was perfect as well and if you do stay here (which I recommend), try taking the Economy Plus room - the cost difference isn't much. Would definitely go back - would have given them 5 stars if it wasn't for the really small room but had I stayed in the Economy Plus room for the entire trip, this is definitely a nice hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Cute boutique hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: annalisajb
Reviews.Content: The rooms at Hotel Denit are quite small yet comfortable. What I liked most was the location (close to Placa Catalunya, La Rambla, and right in the heart of Ciutat Vella). The downside- no pool, view or courtyard. Honestly, you'll be so busy and entertained by Barcelona in general, so that might not even be an issue for some. I would recommend this hotel for those who want to be close to the metro, plan on exploring as much as they can in Barcelona, and those who do not care about a big hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “excellent base for barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Anne G
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Denit is clean, cool and just perfectly placed. It's just off Playa Catalina and about 30 metres from the Aerobus stop. The hotel is on a quiet side street, and whilst you don't get a view, you get a comfy, clean airconditioned room, just a stones throw away from all the major sites. It's not a hotel where you would stay for two weeks, but is ideal for a city break. Looking at the price of other hotels in Barcelona, and considering how much time you actually spend awake in the room, it is excellent value for money. I would definately stay again if I was in the city. My only recommendation is that if you don't get breakfast included in the deal, don't bother spending 15 Euro's on it. You can visit many cafe's nearby and have nicer for less money as the choice is very limited, and no hot food other than toast.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully designed and good service, but tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: Reagan M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Denit Hotel, but found the rooms to be tiny. We had to pack our things away otherwise there was no space to move. The hotel location is excellent, 2 minutes walk to the Airport bus and Las Ramblas and a whole lot of shops and restaurants. The service was excellent and the room was very clean. They used the space quite well, but we felt for the amount of money we were paying the space should have been a little bigger. The hotel could also have a more expansive breakfast for the price paid. Don't get me wrong, we really enjoyed our stay at Denit. The reception staff was excellent and saw to our every need. The only downer was the room size and the limited breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and service, tiny room”
Reviews.Author: Shibiza
Reviews.Content: In general, our experience in the hotel.was very good and the location was perfect- quite and in the center. The service was excelent and the design as well but our room was extremely tiny.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Zoolander”
Reviews.Author: SuitcasesPacked
Reviews.Content: Modern Small Hotel in the heart of tourist section reasonably priced but some challenges. PLUS: - Inexpensive compared to other choices  - Relatively clean - Efficient use of very small space - Staff are helpful CHALLENGES: -Walls paper thin. -If your neighbors are loud you will hear them even if they are several doors away.   - WiFi is slow and doesn't allow secure connections (read no gmail)  - Room Size -the rooms are VERY small, but efficiently laid out.  Using the ceiling shower head, water goes to other areas of small bathroom. Think staying on a boat.  If you have a lot of luggage -I not know how that would fit in the room GOOD TO KNOW: - Hotel is in an small alley like street Breakfast is basic cereal, bread, cheese, juice tea coffee  Ask staff about which local buses you can use to get around.   The hotel is 1/2 a block from a  Plaza Catalunya a very tourist central location if that is your thing. Near to top of Rambla and underground subway and lots of buses.  Like staying 1/2 block from Times Square in New York.  In July it was filled with lots of youthful tourists many American with backpacks & luggage arriving/ departing.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, chic ... loved it.”
Reviews.Author: lazychocolate
Reviews.Content: The hotel is tucked away in a little alley away from Las Ramblas, which is a few blocks away. It's good because it means that you get a good night's rest and plenty of peace and quiet. Was a bit hard to find, but we settled in quickly to our room. The design of the room was a lesson in making a small space work - the sink was hidden in the "wardrobe" and all covered with a curtain, if I remember correctly ... the toilet was hidden behind a sliding door opposite the bed, and there was a small little table with a chair at one end. Those used to lavish hotel furnishings might find it a bit odd, but having been to Scandinavia, I personally enjoyed the room and the minimalism. The room and the hotel is clean, and the bed is comfortable. No complaints about the hotel. It was really very good. PS: There's a lot of good food around the hotel. Make sure you ask the front desk for recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel and Fabulous Location - good for disabled.”
Reviews.Author: Alamain
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Denit for one night in August of 2011. My Mother and father stayed for several nights. We were all very pleased with the rooms and the location was great. I took the airport bus to Plaza de Cataluna (for 5 euro) and it was a very easy 1.5 block walk to the hotel. I got the disabled room which is on the first floor and the bathroom was very accessible. There is an incline from the hotel if you turn right, going up to the main street so a wheelchair would need to be pushed - however, if you go the left out of the hotel there really is no incline - and going left leads you into the Gothic Quarter. The breakfast is simple continental style but it is worth the 7 euros if it isn't included in your room. The decor looks IKEA-ish but it's actually higher-end and designed for the hotel. There is a safe in the room for valuables. The reception desk has a coffee machine and there is also a public use computer with (albeit slow) internet access available without charge. if you want to see the Sagrada Familia I suggest booking tickets online first (perhaps from home) rather than getting there on the day and lining up - if you do that you should start lining up by 8:30am at least otherwise the line is very long. The line for people with tickets was very short.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel and great staff.”
Reviews.Author: charliechaplin15
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in the business room. It was quite spacious compared to most of the hotel rooms in Europe. The room was very clean and serviced daily. Free wi fi and printer as well. The aerobus stops near the hotel from the airport. We couldn't have asked for a better stay. The hotel is very conveniently located. It takes approximately 4-5 minutes to walk to la ramblas and other small shops/larger outlets. There are also plenty of restaurants surrounding the area (ask staff for recommendations). The hotel is also very close to the tourist bus which can be caught close to where the aerobus drops you off. Keep in mind that it is located within the heart of Barcelona and you can pretty much walk anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “God for its money and in the center of everything”
Reviews.Author: kekavasi
Reviews.Content: Hotels (and food) are rather expensive in Barcelona. Denit hotel is a reasonably priced and at a very good location. The rooms are very clean with a fresh and interesting design. The stuff is very helpful, and especially a couple of the girls at the reception provided us with excellent and detailed suggestions for what to visit, where to dine, what to see. We were staying at the third floor of the hotel and it was very quiet, although located a 2-min walk from las ramblas, plaza catalanya, and the shopping street. It is very close to metro stops, buses to the airport (do not try getting to the hotel from the airport by metro, choose aerobus). Excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: claker1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights at the beginning of August. Modern, clean hotel with all the amenities you need including free Wi-Fi. Breakfast included substantial mediterranean options perfect to start a day of wandering the city. Located just steps away from the Plaza Catalunya, perfect location to explore the old town, Sagrada Familia, La Rambla, etc. Welcoming and helpful staff. We paid $126/night with breakfast included, well worth it for the location and breakfast included! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Nos encanto el estilo moderno y excelente precio calidad”
Reviews.Author: Davchelo
Reviews.Content: It is a nice Hotel very modern furniture in the rooms, quality of breakfast are very good. Location is excellent if you like to go to the beaches catch the Metro in Uquinaona to Barceloneta or others in few minutes. Also if you like to go to Sagrada Familia catch the Metro in Catalunya Square. rooms are cleaned and brigthness. I stayed in a room in the back building as it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel for a decent price!”
Reviews.Author: chen676
Reviews.Content: i stayed in hotel denit for 3 nights and i want to recommend it to you all! it was a great stay! the staff were very nice and helpful, the rooms (and all of the hotel in fact) are new and modern and the breakfast was really nice. I got there really early in the morning (because of my flight) and the staff did every thing they cando so i will get my room as soon as possible, and the most importent thing- the location!!!!! the location is just perfect! in the center but in a quiet street!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Hotel in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Aussies10
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from spending four days in wonderful Barcelona. The Hotel Denit was a great find on Tripadvisor for us - and the location is perfect for airport transfers, exploring - close to lots of shopping, restaurants, bars and of course La Rambla - where it all happens!! It is located in a very quiet side street. On checking in the guy on reception was very friendly, efficient and eager to assist with directions etc. All of the staff at reception spoke very good English. He spoke to our airport transfer company in Spanish to ensure we had the right pickup location. Daily we asked for an ice bucket so we could chill our beers after a long hot day out! He even kept our cheeses in the fridge for us! Nothing seemed to be a problem! There is a PC available also for those who wish to check emails or book tours or whatever. Our room (57) faced the street frontage and we found it pretty quiet. Ultra modern, trendy and extremely clean! The IPod Dock was a great touch, a fantastic "rain shower" and our king size bed was very comfy too. Breakfast is pretty basic, bread, muffins, croissants, fruit, cereals tea and a Larazzo coffee machine. Enough to set you up till lunch time!! In summary this is a great hotel - value for money - and would recommend it as a good quality 3 star hotel! Just a tip when out exploring and eating at restaurants - Barcelona has lots of pick pockets and beggars so be very careful with your belongings and don't leave your mobile phone (or cameras) on the table. A family member that we were travelling with had her IPhone stolen off their table by a person who came to them begging for money.....these guys are professionals and before you know it - it was gone!! Just be vigilant. However, don't let that put you off Barcelona - it's a "happening" place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice !”
Reviews.Author: Francis R
Reviews.Content: The Denit hotel is very well located in Barcelona. The gothic area is only 2mn away on foot and the metro can take you directly to the beach in Barceloneta. Rooms are very convenient, bed is very large and comfortable. Design is modern, but does not give a cold impression. The reception is very helpful and offers a good selection of mini bars products. Breakfast offers you a large choice of coffee, milk, croissants, muffins, ham, fresh fruits, breads, etc. The only negative point is the noise made by the doors when closed that can be anoying in the middle of the night. Though it has to be noted that the hotel is in city center and there is no other noises to be noted at night ! I do recommand this hotel, it is a great value !

Reviews.Title: “Clean trendy simple great location, some annoyances...”
Reviews.Author: cagalindo
Reviews.Content: Love the location. Walked to beach takes 30 minutes. Any other atteaction is closer and metro is 5 min away. Supermarket inside El Corte Ingles. Breakfast has milk coffee tea cereal bread croissants toast bananas apple ham cheese water juice and few jams. Shower is trendy but impossible to not get the entire bathroom wet. Get an extra towel you'll need it. Sink is in the open next to the beds, no towel hanger for hand-towels. Wifi is ridiculously hard to get working (impossible for anyone without good knowledge of computers) and the signal is the worst even at breakfast. Walls are thin as plastic, thank god we have a corner room. Can hear next door shower and bathroom. We fell asleep but if you are picky about that, this isn't the hotel for you. I would come back because it does indeed have a great price for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location but poor sound proof”
Reviews.Author: Chuntai
Reviews.Content: Extremely convenient as it is located near major metro station and tour bus stops, and within walking distance to the major shopping area! The street is quiet and free disturbance from outside. But it is a bit too quiet when coming back in the evening especially if you are alone. The door and wall are thin, I woke up by the guests in other room every morning when they close their doors, childen screaming... Not a problem if you are an early starter as well.

Reviews.Title: “Funky, good value, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: samuir33
Reviews.Content: A good value hotel for the location and clean modern styling. The room was a decent size and made very good use of its space with some clever design ideas. It was also spotlessly clean and the staff generally helpful. The buffet breakfast was fine - especially for Barcelona when large cooked breakfasts are not the norm. The location was great - in a quiet street near the border of the old town (but not in the middle of the noisiest areas), and Eixample (with its more interesting and better value eating places), and only two minutes from the airport bus stop.

Reviews.Title: “satisfying central accommodation”
Reviews.Author: markopoulou04
Reviews.Content: easy to find hotel in the centre of the city, near the bus station and the subway!friendly staff, free access to internet, moderate breakfast, the smallest room we have ever stayed in but absolutely cosy, practically designed and daily cleaned! the only problem was the noisy 'neighbours', people who live across the hotel in a small distance from our room since the hotel is situated in a narrow street.however, the problem was dealt with by closing the window.satisfying accommodation for those who enjoy being outdoors most of the day and need the room only to rest!

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: HatTrick4
Reviews.Content: It cost a fortune in cab fare to locate the hotel. It's down an alley without vehicle access. The cab driver tossed us out on the curb and pointed. After we finally were settled in our room I noticed a vial odor on one side of the room. Apparently it was coming from the adjacent room which was completely sealed off (that raised a large flag). We asked to be moved and were sent to the second floor. When our friends checked in, they were given the same room with the odor. Not a good idea when you know each other. On a positive note, it's in a great location. Hop on/off bus tour was directly across the street, the market two blocks away. We walked everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.....thin walls!”
Reviews.Author: IrishAli
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in July. The location is excellent. However, we could hear every move the cleaning ladies made in the hallway each morning. Super annoying! The breakfast is pretty good and the front desk is very helpful. The hotel is very clean. I guess those noisy cleaning ladies do their job well!

Reviews.Title: “Great Modern Hotel in a Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: DonnaLA
Reviews.Content: My husband, teenage daughter and I just returned from 4 nights at the Hotel Denit. While the room is not huge for 3 people, it was recently remodeled so everything is bright, clean and new. The location is wonderful! We took the bus from the airport to Plaza Cataluna and the hotel is literally 1 block from the bus stop. That was very convenient. We even took the bus back to the airport since the buses run every 5 minutes and only cost 5 euros each way. The hotel is also right near the Ramblas and other nice restaurants and tapas bars. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel and will return next time I am in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Denit Has It All”
Reviews.Author: MrLee43
Reviews.Content: In May, 2011 my wife and I spent five days at the Denit Hotel. We found it exceptional in its 1. LOCATION [minutes to the Gothic quarter, Ramblas, Airport bus, HoHo Bus, restaurants, pastry & gelato shops, Catalunya Plaza, metro stop, supermarket in El Cortez Norte Department Store in the Plaza], 2. SAFETY of neighborhood, 3. HELPFULNESS of staff, 4. free & reliable INTERNET service. 5. CLEANLINESS, and 6. MAINTENANCE of facility. We especially enjoyed the individual 7. AIR CONDITIONING in our room as well as the flat screen Sony TV. The room is very modern in decor [all white with minimal furnishings, apparently designed and furnished by IKEA]. Not a large room [approximately 10x25 feet] with double bed, desk, one chair but very adequate. Toilet and shower combined but both have plenty of room. 8. The monogrammed towels are exceptionally lush with bath towel being extra large at approximately 40x60 inches. We did not participate in the breakfast so we can not comment on its content or value.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST little hotel”
Reviews.Author: JudeandJem
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Denit for four nights in early July, 2011, and hope to be back. Perhaps the very best thing is the staff, from the sweet and helpful staff on the desk to the pleasant women looking after the buffet breakfast. They are unfailingly helpful--they even photocopied for me a conference paper I needed to change at the last minute, for which there was no charge. We stayed in the business room (think I've got the term right, but the top of their range) and it was immaculately clean, and while it was small it wasn't poky. Free WIFI, a terrific shower and a bath, a safe, giant towels, comfortable bed, reverse-cycle aircon, and an openable window over a very narrow courtyard. Some rooms might have a better outlook? Breakfast's not great--cocopops or cornflakes, bread (good baguette) and not very good croissants, but lots of coffee and hot milk, which was really all I needed. Limited fresh fruit. Would be much improved by the addition of yoghurt and a classier form of cereal--a simple muesli, for instance. It's on a really quiet lane called Estruc (no traffic, but city workers were digging up the pavement and we couldn't hear a thing from our room). It's a two-minute walk to Las Ramblas and Placa Catalunya. Very close to the airport bus stop, and to a taxi rank. Good restaurants nearby (the staff will recommend places). The best food we had was at Dentelliere--do go there!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Lovely staff.”
Reviews.Author: Louisa1989
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in the most perfect location, within minutes walking distance of Placa de Catalunya and La Rambla, as well as the Barri Gotic. Staff made the stay very enjoyable and I thought the rates were very reasonable (good to book online early I think). I would certainly recommend it to anyone visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Nice design and great location”
Reviews.Author: leto1972
Reviews.Content: The hotel design is very attractive - very modern facilities - The location is great as close to the center of downtown Barcelona, 2 subway station at < 3 min and still in a quiet street The breakfast choice was pretty limited

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay but a lot of room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: rkstrim
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Denit Hotel for 9 days, in the business double room. After staying for such long time I could experience the good and bad sides of living in Denit. I especially liked the excellent location of the hotel, near the Catalunya square (which is a tourist center of Barcelona). This location provides excellent means of communication, both metro and buses are very near. In fact, most important places are so close, that you may even want reach them on foot, which is exactly what I did. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful, not much to say here because I was satisfied. The room was clean, bright and very nice. Both walls and windows were soundproofed adequately - it was not possible to hear anything from the street or other rooms in the hotel. However the door was not soundproofed at all, which is irritating when people were walking or talking in the corridor at night. In my opinion the bathroom needs some serious changes. For example: the shower lacked the door. It resulted in water splashing all over the bathroom when shower was used. Also, there was no handle in the shower, which made washing feet a bit more difficult. For some unknown reason, the sink was located not in the bathroom, but in the room, near door to the bathroom. Considering the fact that bathroom was flooded every time shower was used, installing the sink in a room was not a bad decision. I liked the fact that bathroom was thoroughly cleaned every day. The breakfast was served on an underground floor, in a buffet-style way, and I have to admit that it was quite tasty. However, there was very little change in menu during my stay. Most of the served food types were served every day, so for 9 days I was eating the same kind of ham and cheese. Which got a little bland after a few days. The only kind of available vegetable was a tomato. Fruits were changed almost every day. The hotel advertises having a free internet in each room. I would not exactly call it free. The service is provided by Kubi Wireless, which seems to be a popular Spanish Wi-Fi company. The catch is that for free you're only getting access to web pages (using http protocol). That means you can access google, facebook, or any other web site. However, if you try to access your e-mail from software like Apple Mail, Microsoft Outlook, Mozilla Thunderbird, or try to use VPN to connect to your work, or try to use SSH client, etc., then you're out of luck. Login page explains that you need to buy "premium" service to get full access to the internet! One of the most important factors for me was the price. Definitely, Denit's price is unbeatable in this part of Barcelona. I doubt you could find better quality for similar price. Some of my problems were probably related to the fact, that Denit is designed for one, maybe two night stays (after all it is "Night&Breakfast"). I've deliberately ignored this fact, and some of my experiences described above came from this. Overall it was a very nice stay. I recommend it, if you're looking for a place to stay for a few nights.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful clean quiet hotel in a great city”
Reviews.Author: spunkamupolis
Reviews.Content: The rooms were small (even in business double) but very clean and crisply decorated. For a three-star hotel, I do not think one could do any better. The receptionists all spoke English well (so do lots of other people in Barcelona). The rooms are a bit short on natural light, but that is because the hotel is in an alley- which is an advantage as it kept things quiet. We also felt safe walking around at all times of the day and night. The breakfast gets the day off to a good start; there is a nice variety of bread, cereal, fruit and other things. Overall we were very satisfied. This is not a luxury hotel, nor does it claim to be. But if you plan to be out and about in Barcelona, as we were, and are really in the hotel to sleep and clean up, this is a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & superb staff”
Reviews.Author: londo16
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in great location for everything. Although in the centre of town very quiet. Staff very helpful,

Reviews.Title: “Clean but small room.”
Reviews.Author: PaulMarc
Reviews.Content: Good points: Good location if you are travelling from The airport. Easy walk To La Rambles. Sqeeky clean! It is worth reading The little guide book in your room - wish I had read it before We got home! Near night life. Beach is walkable but wear sensible shoes! Night bus stops near by and goes directly To the beach and you can use your 10 Journey ticket on it. Near the best sangria bar in town, Orgasmic cafe in St. Augustine Place. Nice walk in shower. Bad points: Room was tiny. Not a nice view- over looking dirty back yard and could see into neighbours windows. Breakfast nothing special and ran out of croissants before we got down on our first evening- but the waitress did make an extra effort To re-fill the basket for me the next morning :) And it was a shame To be eating it in a basement with no windows on a 28 degree sunny morning, how ever stylish it was! Coffee bad and also no drink facilities in room. Next time I will stay nearer sea front and somewhere with a nice balcony overlooking a square. Amd a breakfast terrace. Bad points:

Reviews.Title: “Fun little boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: DeeLovesToTravel
Reviews.Content: Hotel Denit is a cute, funky little boutique hotel. Right off Plaza Cataluna, the location is excellent, however, it is important to note that vehicles cannot directly access the hotel, so if you can't walk the 50 meters from the main road, than this is not the right hotel for you. The rooms are small, but well appointed and CLEAN. A light continental breakfast was included and all 8 members of our party were satisfied. The staff is one of the best features of this hotel - they were extremely helpful and very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, comfortable, central, clean and modern”
Reviews.Author: AlexandraKP
Reviews.Content: Down a narrow alley near Placa Catalunya, the hotel is near the centre of old Barcelona and perfect for getting around. The rooms are clean and well furnished in pleasant white and soft stone. Excellent walk-in shower. The staff are really helpful. Our only gripe was with breakfast: in such an establishment, real fresh coffee would be so much better than vacuum flasks, no eggs etc. Plenty of alternatives in cafes nearby. Rooms are spacious and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific modern hotel in the Gothic Quarter”
Reviews.Author: PSUGrad2005
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for two nights at Hotel Denit last summer, and loved it! This is certainly not your classic European hotel, but we loved the very modern style (even if it did feel a bit like sleeping in an Ikea catalog, but hey, who hasn't wanted to have a hip room like that at some point!) The room was small by American standards, but fairly roomy for Europe, and the bed was quite comfortable. The shower was also quite nice, with a large faucet that hung down from the ceiling, and it was a bit like showering in a rainstorm. The included breakfast was good, but not quite as varied as the other hotels we stayed in during this trip -- so it was a good way to start a day, but nothing special. The location in the Gothic Quarter was great, with a lot of fun alleys to explore and an easy walk to Las Ramblas. It's situated on a narrow street, and wasn't well signed from the larger roads, but our taxi driver had no problem finding it. I wasn't sure the cab was going to fit down the alley though! Also, it's half a block from Plaça de Catalunya and was close to the Aerobus stop, which was nice for our early morning flight, since then we didn't have to drag our suitcases that far to catch the bus to the airport. As a note, the free internet was only available in the lobby, and they did have a computer and printer set up that you could use to print your boarding documents. Overall, we loved our stay in Hotel Denit, and would absolutely stay there again on a return trip to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, excellent beds, quite rooms and top service”
Reviews.Author: Sifonet
Reviews.Content: This is a little gem in the centre of Barcelona, personally I wouldn't consider going anywhere else, great attention to detail, feels like home.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern design in an excellent central location, tucked away down a quiet side street.”
Reviews.Author: JeffC2493
Reviews.Content: Very clean room and VERY quiet at all times. A perfect central location with easy access to tour and airport bus services. Good buffet breakfast - but no restaurant or bar. Bright, minimalist, modern design may not suit all tastes but fine for us. Very pleasant service. Would definitely chose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful introduction to Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: bearburger
Reviews.Content: Hotel Denit Barcelona was such a pleasant surprise. Even though the room was small (probably too small for 3 people), it was clean, air-conditioned and had windows that let fresh air circulate through the room. David was exceptionally helpful in giving our family instructions to Xampaneria. We would have never found the place and would never had the most memorable experience at Barcelona. David also was very helpful in helping us reheat our leftover paella from Can Majo for our late night snack. David, thank you again.

Reviews.Title: “What a location!”
Reviews.Author: MJTRlz
Reviews.Content: We stayed last week for 5 nights at hotel Denit. The hotel is in a wonderful location,very close to most main attractions and bus stations .The hotel is very clean ,the staff friendly and helpful.The room is small but convenient,looking at a small and quiet street.The breakfast is a bit disappointing .Nevertheless I highly recommend staying at this hotel and think about staying there again while going to Barcelona in the future.

Reviews.Title: “3rd visit and still as good”
Reviews.Author: LoisChadwick
Reviews.Content: This is the third time we have stayed at the Denit and it is still as good as the first time. The location is fantastic really handy fir the airport Bus and very central. The staff are fantastic and very helpful and friendly. Will definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Comfort, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: kirk20003
Reviews.Content: So we booked 5 nights here for our full time in Barcelona before heading north into Costa Brava. Taking the low cost Airport Shuttle Bus leaves you at the main plaza just steps from your hotel. Just remember when the bus lets your outside the square, quickly eye-ball the side of the park with the Hard Rock Cafe and head left on the side street on that side of the park using the map they provide you and you will have no problem finding this place. It is down a very little used alley. Best part of this location is its quiet both from the rooms next to you (great soundproofing) and fact that instead of heading to the right out the door of the hotel, hit the busy plaza and down Las Rablas, you can exit left and skip the crowds and make your way zig zagging down fun alleyways. Reception if fantastic. Remember your paying significantly less at this place, and while they do not skimp on comfort or style, the rooms are smaller and spaces in general are as well in the hotel. We had a business deluxe that was bigger then average room but still small by US standards but perfectly fine. The shower was large with translucent glass doors to the main room -- maybe for the privacy picky it might be a bit of a problem, but we think not as you can not see clearly in. Breafkast was included in our rate -- very good but odd they did not include yogurt which is a staple at most Euro breakfasts. Highly recommend mgmt throw this down at the table ;) Great advice for eating Tapas around the corner the first night we didnt feel like going far (Taller Tappas). I think its great find. The only complaint was the free internet was painfully slow. Painful I say. We would go back here no questions asked for the value, style, customer service, and location.

Reviews.Title: “We recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: marciacooper
Reviews.Content: Quiet place in central location. Clean and pleasant accommodations. Helpful friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: Juvilesboy
Reviews.Content: I wood like to say that the reception staff were very welcoming and friendly during my visit. This is not usual for Spanish hotels, where the lack of customer service which permeates most Spanish establishments is evidenced. The rooms were small but perfectly adequate. The location was easy to find and very close to the airport bus location, and a taxi is not needed. The room was very quiet making sleeping easy. The breakfast was excellent with lots of choices, unusual for a Spanish hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean room, contemporary and a good value”
Reviews.Author: rstuder4
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a family with 2 toddlers and had an extra bed in our room. It was one of the larger rooms which made it space wise ok. I don't expect large rooms in major European cities and it was appropriate for our needs. All was updated with modern plumbing and flat screen TV. The room and hotel was clean and we enjoyed the continental breakfast, especially the croissants. The staff was helpful and friendly. The location is excellent with La Rambla and many restaurants and more close by. My only concern would be noise at night from a nearby wine bar... maybe hang out there long enough so it won't matter.... I would stay here again on a future Barcelona trip.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: luvabreak
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights pre-cruise and then another 2 nights post cruise. It was already recommended to me by a friend but I also made sure to check other reviews on Trip Advisor. The hotel is located down an alley way off a main street. Our taxi driver was not familiar with the address of the hotel but I showed him the map that was on the Hotel Denit website and lucky I did, as he knew how to get there from the main street. MY RECOMMENDATION TO YOU IS TO PRINT THE MAP ON THE WEBSITE. The hotel is a 1 minute walk from Placa De Catalunya. From the Placa you can get on the hop on/hop off buses (highly recommend this - we saw the entire city in 1 day). The Aero Bus also stops at this location so you can easily catch the bus from the airport or catch one to the airport. The cost was 5.20 Euro per adult. From the outside, the hotel resembles a shop front. It is very cool and funky. The reception staff are all lovely. They speak english very well and were very helpful with directions and recommendations. The hotel is very clean and white. Our room both times was clean and comfortable. We selected the business double room both times. The shower and toilet are located together in a wet room setting. This looks great ,but be aware that the tiles around the toilet get very slippery after the shower has been used. The bed was king size and very comfortable. They offered cable tv on a large screen plasma. Our room overlooked the alley way which was fine as there is no noise at all coming from below. Breakfast was included with our room and it was delicious! We actually looked forward to it each morning. There is a selection of 2 cereals, juice, coffee, fresh fruit, croissants, bread, rolls, ham, cheese, tomatoes, cupcakes. When we arrived on a Sunday, most of the stores are closed. So if you were to walk around the nearby alley ways you would think you were in a dingy city. All stores have roller shutters which are closed on a Sunday. Come Monday, the alley streets came alive with colourful shop fronts and people everywhere! Las Ramblas, the main street, is only a couple of minutes walk from the Denit. It is very tourity indeed. The shops are mostly souvenir shops all selling the same stuff. Traffic flows down Las Ramblas on either side of a paved walkway (mall). As you walk down the mall you are surrounded by lots of people, street performers and pick pockets! Hold onto your handbags. Wear one over your head and shoulder, that hangs across the front of your body. Hold onto it very tightly. There are a lot of distractions and you will be looking up, down, left and right at all these amazing things. Don't think it can't happen to you - 2 women from our cruise had their pures stolen out of their handbags whilst we wre touring through Rome and Florence in Italy. Barcelona is also a known area for pick pockets and BEGGERS. We were approached several times by young and old female beggers holding out cups and asking for money. Just walk by and ignore them. We also saw a woman with a baby sitting on the sidwalk begging for money. If you walk all the way down Las Ramblas towards the water, you will reach the marina. There is a shopping centre there which is the only place we found open on a Sunday. There are food stalls there as well as a few restaurants. We ate at Tapa Tapa located just outside of the centre. We thought it would be a real spanish experience. The menus are in english and have pictures so you can see exactly what you will get. We found the food okay. It wasn't the best but the service was good and we enjoyed the views around us. I wouldn't eat there again though. Also on Las Ramblas there are many restaurants and some have people out the front inviting you in. We didn't eat in any of them as they didn't look great and I don't like places that have to grab people from the street. We did eat at an italian restaurant - why my husband selected Italian food in Spain I don't know. He ate a pizza which he said was good. I had a soup. Enough said. On our second last night at the Denit we found the best restaurant. It is called Taller Tapas and is located just around the corner from the hotel. Step out of the hotel and turn left. Walk to the end of the alley way and turn left again. Walk along this street and nearing the end of the alley on the right you will find the restaurant. It was the best tapas we had in Barcelona (and also in Australia). We ate there on our last 2 nights. First night we selected various tapas dishes and shared. Leave room for the dark & white chocolate mousse - it melts in your mouth. The second night we ordered the seafood paella. It cost only 12.80 Euro. Amazing price for a wonderful dish. The serve isn't huge - perfect for 1 but if you are sharing then you may wish to order some tapas to have beforehand - it takes 20 mintes for the paella, but worth the wait. Denit's location is the best, it is great value for money and the rooms are clean, white and comfortable. There is a hair dryer in each room but if you have wild hair like me you may wish to still bring your own, theirs is not powerful enough. My only negative (and this is indeed very minor) is that there isn't a retractable clothes line in the wet room. Some of us wash our smalls rather than send them to the dry cleaner. I would definitely stay there again and would recommend it to family and friends. The rooms only house 1 - 2 persons so you will need to book more than 1 room if you are a family of 4 or more.

Reviews.Title: “Is this your left luggage room??”
Reviews.Author: MissLiddia
Reviews.Content: This hotel featured in an article we read in the observer a short while ago. It was highlighted as being good value accommodation on a budget. The denit is what it is, clean and white enough with basic amenities and a friendly front desk. Breakfast room is spacious and provides a basic start to your day. The hotel is very well placed and you can just about walk to wherever you have in mind from there. We took the long stay offer and were given room 25 on arrival - this room is very small and should by all rights be classed as a single occupancy room. For comfort and ease, my partner and I took turns to change while the other took a short stroll elsewhere as we found there just isn't the room to maneuver in such a small space . I stress again the room is small. Front desk did hear my concerns but due to the hotel being fully booked we could not be moved to another room. Another point which has already been mentioned on previous posts is the shower facility. There is no divide between shower and toilet meaning the toilet gets showered. This is quite obviously a planning fault and if you do intend to use the toilet, make sure it is before a shower and not after as the whole area is wet through. I made this point clear to the front desk and they seemed surprised...yet as I say, this has been raised in previous posts already so I question how big a surprise it was.
