We had a great stay in Barcelona and spent as little time as possible in the hotel which was our intention but it is nice to come back to a place where one can relax and refresh and we felt that it was just bad luck getting room 25.

Reviews.Title: “4 star quality in a 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: OandL
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights and very happy with all aspects. Modern new hotel, clean spacious room, king comfy bed, sound proof. Great location; one block to city center, hop on/off bus, city bus, shopping and Las Rambla. Walked to many attractions or easy bus ride. Good breakfast. Excellent services. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: MiamiBeachFLTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel twice while in Barcelona . The hotel is centrally located, clean the staff is very nice and overall a very pleasant stay and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Nice hotel... walls a bit on the thin side”
Reviews.Author: YogicBiker
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really well situated and I felt completely safe and comfortable as a single female traveller. Situated less than 5 minute walk from the airport bus drop off at Plaza Catalunya. I was surprised to find breakfast was included in the cost which made it very reasonable., The room was simple, clean and modern. Good use of space. A bit on the small side unless you're sharing with a VERY good friend or your significant other. Only note to bear in mind is that the walls are on the thin sound - and it seems each room has one other room on it's partition wall, so you may be able to hear more than you bargained for from your neighbours.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in best location in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Edis_Luli
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Denit hotel made our trip to Barcelona even more complete and enjoyable. The hotel is in central location and you can literally walk and in few minutes see yourself in the gotic area of Barcelona surrounded with beautiful buildings made by the biggest names in world of architecture. Couple of minutes walking from the hotel you can also reach the main shopping area in Barcelona. The night life and dinning possibilities are limitless around Denit hotel. As for the hotel itself, be ready for unique modernism and simplicity influenced design with very clean lines. The rooms are also uniquely designed and the modest space is maximally used providing the guest with sufficient commodity. The hotel is very clean. Rooms are regularly cleaned and sheets and towels changed - with extra carefulness by the cleaning lady. The staff is very friendly and ready to assist you on what ever you need. Luli & Edis, Kosova

Reviews.Title: “Resonable value,great location”
Reviews.Author: whiterose625
Reviews.Content: Nice clean rooms, no noise from the street so easy to sleep, although some noise from corridor and room next door. Clean, fresh and modern, pleasant room. Badly designed shower/toilet area :-as there is no screen or divide between the 2 and the floor is relatively flat, once you have showered you need to paddle in order to use the toilet for the balance of the evening. Breakfast is very basic, but sufficient...could benefit from more healthy options such as fruit. Staff were really friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler0222
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Denit for two nights after a cruise.The location is convenient to many Barcelona sights. The reception staff where all excellent,professional and friendly.Our room, located on an inner courtyard was quiet and comfortable.We will definitely choose this hotel again for future visits to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Agneta187497
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Denit was in a great location in Barcelona very close to La Rambla as well as close to the old city with a number of nice restaurants and in walking distance to the sea.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms - very small !!!”
Reviews.Author: OzzyTraveller101
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Denit was in a great location in Barcelona, close to La Rambla as well as a number of nice restaurants and in walking distance to a central metro station. The room was very clean however was actually smaller than my bedroom at home and I live in a unit !!!! The room was tiny for two people - I wouldn't recommend it and when you are in the shower you get water everywhere. The toilet gets wet, the toilet paper gets wet and you end up getting water in the room - very poorly designed. Also, being able to hear people in the next room having a conversation is another downside. We toured Europe and this would defintely be located down the bottom of the list.....I said small.....but this is probably and understatement.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, friendly hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LenaNgMunYee
Reviews.Content: Wouldnt say that it was the trendiest hotel but it was a nice and warm hotel to stay in. Staff was friendly and helpful. Location was good.

Reviews.Title: “Best spot in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: malbak
Reviews.Content: Excellent small modern hotel right in the centre of town. Only 200m from Catalunya Square, yet down a very quiet sidestreet, for us an ideal location. The staff were all very pleasant and helpful and the left luggage room is a real boon for early arrivals. Our standard double room was a good size with a very large comfortable bed. The modern bathroom was very clean but the powerful shower needed some care. Other reviewers have mentioned breakfast, it was on offer at 6 euros but we preffered to have a coffee at one of the many local cafes. A real bonus is the aerobus giving direct trips to the airport, it stops on the Denit side (south) of Catalunya Square and only costs 5:30 euros I would certainly use this hotel again if visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Denit - A great place to stay. Front desk was amazing!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Boomer21848
Reviews.Content: Clean, nice, friendly no frills hotel. 2 blocks from the old town.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: HenkEindhoven
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a short break. Nice hotel. Top Location. Modern, simple and functional. As they advertise themselves. Better consider this place as a very luxurious bed and breakfast rather than a hotel. Rooms are clean, good bed, modern and clean bathroom. However, rooms are somewhat small, but for a short break it's perfect. Service at desk was polite and friendly. Cons: * Rooms are noisy. Isolation towards the street is perfect but within the hotel too much noise and light pollution. * Breakfast is mediocre and service there could be better, especially for hotel standards * Got overcharged 93 euro's for 1 bottle of water on the bill. When i noticed it, i received friendly apologies and a correction on the bill. However, i still think this is a little sloppy. Conclusion: nice modern place on perfect location, friendly staff. Still some flaws for hotel standards. For B & B standards fine. Good value for Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money and very well positioned”
Reviews.Author: Win53
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very convenient for public transport and the major tourist areas of Barcelona. We were impressed by the size and comfort of the room for the price, and the hotel staff were pleasant and helpful. The breakfast wasn't great but it was perfectly acceptable as long as you are not expecting a traditional British fry-up. Overall we found it very good value for money and we certainly intend to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: sieramail
Reviews.Content: Quick arrival from Plaza Catalunya, cannot be easier when coming from the airport. Very neat and cosy rooms, like in official photos, contemporary design and tips as design elements for discovering the city. Everyday room service for spotless cleanliness. Simple but tasty breakfast, amazing croissants! Shopping area just round the corner. Could leave the luggage even after check out. Would deffinitely come back once in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the Center”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoYan
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the Hotel Denit Barcelona for 4 nights. Its location is perfect. One block away from Placa de Catalunya and the Aerobus (goes to the airport) stop. It is in the middle of a narrow side street, always quiet. The huge department store El Corte Ingles is across the street. In its basement there is the Supermercado (supermarket). It has every thing you need (food, drink) and more. The hotel staff is very friendly and the front desk agents speak English. The hotel style is very modern and clean, with a black-and-white color scheme through out. We booked a double room with 2 beds and they are 2 twin beds put close together. It worked out perfect for us. However, I overheard one couple complaining to the fron desk that they wanted one big bed, instead of 2 small beds put together. Our first impression of the room is it is very simple and clean and small. But that is to be expected. There is one table and one director style chair. The sink is in the same room. The toilet and the shower(only) are in the same room with frosted glass sliding door. It looks really cool with the light on from inside. However, after a shower the floor infront of the toilet gets very slippery. That is the only design flaw I see. There is no view other than the back windows from other rooms and local residents laundry hung out to dry. The flat screen TV is mounted on the wall facing the beds. No English channel programming, not even the BBC World, let alone CNN. There is no microwave or coffee maker in our room. There is a computer and printer in the hotel lobbby. No free Wi-Fi. The hotel offers a cold breakfast buffet for 6 euro per person. We just bought orange juice, fruits and croissants from Supermercado. Saved a lot of money and time. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel for its convenient location for any travelor who is after function more than luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Best value, great room and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: SaSa31
Reviews.Content: We had a 4 night stay recently and thoroughly enjoyed Hotel Denit. We got upgraded to a bigger room and really appreciated the extra space. All the previous positive comments regarding the value and location are correct. If I had to complain, it would be the bathroom and how the water goes everywhere after you have a shower. Also, I want to warn fellow travellors who catch the aerobus from the airport to Pl Catalunya. We arrived late at night after a delayed flight and we got sprayed with a substance like 'bird poo' not long after getting off the bus. We had read the theft&safety thread on the tripadvisor forum and were well aware of this popular scam in barcelona. We went out the following night and saw the same woman who offerred us a tissue hanging around the area so can only assume that they are there most nights hoping to pickpocket some tourists. Overall great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect 3 star hotel in the middle of Barça”
Reviews.Author: Fabienne8318
Reviews.Content: I've been there before (in 2009) and it is still the best choice! Next to plaça de catalunya, very quiet, best value i guess, free wi-fi, still clean rooms and awesome staff! We enjoyed our stay and would chose this perfect hotel again. This time we've stayed in a economy double room, it is small but it fits if you don't stay a lot in your room. Best you can get as a couple is definitely the economy plus double room, really spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 5 mins from La Ramblas and price was right too!”
Reviews.Author: Cat72
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days, great central location. Breakfast is included in the price unlike the majority of hotels in BCN. It is a buffet breakfast with a choice of fruits, cereals, cheese, drinks, bread and cured ham - which was more than adequate for us. Rooms are adequate, and modern in design as is the whole of the hotel. No problems with any noise. Very handy for the airport bus too! This is my second time to BCN and the first time I stayed out of the centre. This meant I spent more time using the metro and less time exploring the city, even though the metro is very efficient, frequent and on time! For our third time we would definately stay at Hotel Denit again.

Reviews.Title: “Central location for lovers of Ikea!”
Reviews.Author: AndyGB
Reviews.Content: Hotel Denit is very centrally located in a small side street (meaning it is away from the general noise of the city) close to the Gothic quarter, La Ramblas and the Place Catalunya. The Casa Batillo is also within walking distance. The hotel itself has been renovated in an ultra modern Ikea style. It is comfortable but a little minimalist with everything decorated in stark white. Rooms are comfortable but it would have been nice if a mini-bar and tea/coffee making facilities had been provided. To be fair, reception operate a pay bar/cafeteria service on a 24 hour basis. free wi-fi is available for 30 minutes each day in your room and unlimited in the lobby. Breakfast is provided with a limited choice of 2 cereals, meat, cheese and fruit. The hotel is within walking distance of many excellent and reasonably priced restaurants. Staff are extremely friendly and helpful and gave us recommendations each night on where to eat, all of which proved to be great (although eating in Barcelona is great anyway!). We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: lar86
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the Hotel Denit. We travel a lot, and while we don't prioritize luxury accommodations, and do look for hotels that are clean, comfortable and reasonably priced for their location. We also enjoy places that have a bit of style or interesting design elements. The Denit was all of those things. The hotel is just a block off of the busiest tourist area in the city, but it is, as others have said, really quiet. We took the precaution of asking in advance for a quiet room, and were given a room on the top floor, in a corner away from the street. We heard absolutely no street noise the weekend we were there. The room was small, but it was a thoughtfully laid out, crisp and comfortable. The shower was good and the water was hot. The staff spoke perfect English, and were able to provide useful information about restaurants, etc. I would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Great stay”
Reviews.Author: MCZedeler
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel based on reviews here at tripadvisor and can honoustly say that nobody was lying :-) The hotel is located in a small sidestreet off the Plaza Catalunya in the northern part of the Gothic Quarter ,which made transfering to and from the airport easy. Within a fice minute walk from here you have access to eateries, the rambla, busses and metro so it is a very convinient location. I had opted for a business room which gave us the bigger bed, which also meant a bigger room. A couple of things to be aware of with these rooms are: The toilet and the room are only seperated by a "sanded" glass door, so what ever you do in there can be heard and in the room, the door to the hallway could also have been a bit more soundproof, and the TV could offer an English News channel other than that no complaints. The bed was very comfortable. The also have a breakfast option which cost €6 per person and consisted of a selection of bread and toppings. I found it more than adequate. If you don't like the coffee then there is a starbucks just round the corner (in the oppisite direction of the Plaza Catalunya).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: b_daygirlhere
Reviews.Content: Great hotel situated at Plaza Catalunya though very quiet (on a tiny narrow street away from the crowd). The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful, good services, good value for money, very clean and neat, modern room (looked exactly as in the photos). The room is tiny though but if you`re planning to spend your day out it`s perfect:-) Breakfast is not included (they have the classic continental b-fast which is only 6 EUR). Definitely recommend the hotel for a get-away, above all location is extremely good (the aero-bus leaves you at 2 minute walking distance from the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “brilliant”
Reviews.Author: PENNYMCIVOR888
Reviews.Content: brilliant, concept, lovely people, great location, perfect

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Denit”
Reviews.Author: weatherman1974
Reviews.Content: Usually when I travel to Europe, I stay in accomodations that are suggested by European travel guru Rick Steves. But this time, I consulted TripAdvisor, and found Hotel Denit Barcelona based upon the many positive reviews left by other TripAdvisor members. The location of Denit is incredible; Only a 1 minute walk to or from the Placa de Catalunya and Aerobus stop, and a two minute walk to the popular La Rambla. The Denit is nestled between two alleys, so sleep quality for my seven nights there was great; Absolutely no traffic noise whatsoever despite the Place de Catalunya being very close. The only noise I encountered in the hotel was the occasional inconsiderate guest allowing their door to slam late at night or early in the morning. My room was clean and comfortable; Linens on the bed were clean and new, with towels in the bathroom clean, large, and fluffy. Housekeeping did a geat job each day freshening the room. Personnel at the front desk were polite and friendly and spoke great English. In the past, other TripAdvisor members have commented how poor the breakfast was in the morning at Denit. This was completely NOT the case while I was there, as the breakfast consisted of two types of cold cereal, several types of fresh fruit (pineapple, pears, oranges, and apples), several types of fresh bread (croissants, sourdough, baguettes), two types of muffins (chocolate and white), chocolate doughnuts, white cheese, two types of ham (both cold ham and the expensive Iberian-cured variety), coffee, bottled water, and milk. It is a VERY filling breakfast and more than enough to get you going in the morning! If I visit Barcelona again in the future I will definitely stay at Denit, and I would strongly suggest this hotel to any friends visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great, accomodating staff in the perfectly located hotel!”
Reviews.Author: infotechsm
Reviews.Content: Our company planned a trip to Barcelona this year and had a great experience at Hotel Denit. They were extremely accomodating to us in the planning stages, and switched around, added and dropped rooms for us up until right before the stay. Upon arrival, while the hotel seems to be located down a slightly scketchy street, we actually found the location to be completely ideal. A short walk to the Aerobus, La Rambla, and just about everything else in the Gothic Quarter. The hotel itself had a great modern, minimilistic design. The only negative about the rooms was that this single rooms some of our employees stayed in were very, very small, but that seems to just be Europe for you. Also, the showers are cool, but seem to have a design flaw that makes it so that water gets all over the place. All of us had issues with that. The breakfast at the Hotel was a good, typical hotel breakfast, Spanish style. The staff was amazing. Although the hotel has little postings all over with cool things to do aorund Barcelona, we found way cooler stuff by talking to the staff, and they all seemed to appreciate be inquired upon for their personal favorite hot spots. The only big complaint we had was the internet. People had trouble accessing it from their rooms, and it seems silly to only get 30 minutes free per day. The free wi-fi in the lobby was definately great though. Overall, we had a great experience with Hotel Denit. They were extemely accomodating to our large and sometimes demanding group, and the hotel itself was beautiful. The location and price make this hotel a must for anyone visiting Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a City Break!”
Reviews.Author: ndcharnwood
Reviews.Content: Friendly helpful staff. Clean and well equipped. Cool design. Very comfortable. Central location but in a quiet street, so you can sleep uninterrupted. We will definitely stay here again if we travel to Barcelona again,

Reviews.Title: “Nos gusto A LOTISSIMO!!!”
Reviews.Author: egonx
Reviews.Content: Very well designed and smart solutions within that small building. It's ideal for a stay with ur couple, not so much if u have to share the room with ur boss :))) because the bathroom (btw, fantastic shower) hasn t enough privacy. Bed very good and the best of the best is localization, just 50 m from Pl. Catalunya!!! Very kind and dilligent attention. Breakfast not special, but doesnt matter if u r in one of the most "gastronomic" cities in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and contemporary hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: CulturalTraveler7
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the cleanest I have ever stayed in; it felt new and well taken care of, and the staff were very friendly. The room - an Economy Double - was not large, but because of its layout and design it was comfortable and completely fine for a short stay. The hotel is located in a small alley off a main street, but is easily accessible, and in an excellent location in one of the most central areas of Barcelona. The only drawback - for those that like to relax with anything other than constant recycling of news coverage on CNN or the BBC - is that there are no English channels available on TV, which I found surprising given that the hotel caters to an international clientele. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Barcelona who prefers a more contemporary environment in a fantastic location near MACBA (the museum of contemporary art) , several Gaudi buildings, La Rambla and other main shopping areas.

Reviews.Title: “Great bang for your Euro”
Reviews.Author: HilaryR51
Reviews.Content: We loved the Denit - very modern and well designed. The location was great. It's an easy walk from the Square where the airport bus drops you off. The service was good. The staff was helpful. The breakfast was a great value and included in the nightly rate. Next time we're in Barcelona, we plan to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: reidlf
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Denit is clean, quiet and perfectly located in the Barri Gothic area of Barcelona. From Denit you can easily access museums, shopping and the metro. There are some terrific non-touristy restaurants within walking distance to enjoy great tapas and wine. Denit is located on a quiet pedestrian street so there is no street noise. The staff was friendly and helpful and could easily (and happily) communicate in English. The rooms have a simple modern and minimalist design. There is a breakfast provided that has decent food to start off your day. The only downside was the Wi-Fi set up at the hotel. There is free Wi-Fi in the lobby area but not in the rooms. There is wireless you can pay for in your room but it is expensive (~ 15 Euros a day) and unreliable so not worth the money or headache. I purchased a day access from their wireless provider when I first arrived and it was slow and often timed out. This was the only downside of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Modern Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: batravellerToronto
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the centre of Barcelona very close to the subway, airport buses, the main square and shopping. The rooms were very modern with a cool looking bathroom. The rooms are small but very clean and well decorated. I would definately stay at the hotel Denit again.

Reviews.Title: “Warm”
Reviews.Author: Ape1978
Reviews.Content: My first time in Barcelona has been a very success not only because of the beautiful city but also thanks to the kind and warm atmosphere at the Denit Hotel. Receptionists have been very helpful and always smiling. This can make a difference! in one word....Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “In one word - EXCELLENT!”
Reviews.Author: gilmeir
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel through this site, and didn't get disappointed at all! It's location is just great, 2 minutes from Pl.Catalunya, but in a quiet alley (without any suspicious night characters) which allows a great sleep quality. The room is designed very modernly, a bit strange at the beginning (the sink is next to the cloths closet) but I found it very special and unique - quite different than any other hotels I've been to. The front desk staff is nice and all of them speak fluent english, which helps a lot. As well as the continental breakfast which is modest but satisfying for the good price. At the bottom line - I strongly recommend this hotel for anyone - from youngsters that look for a cheap place with a good value - to elders who seek for a small quiet place just in the center of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent City Hotel, very modern Design”
Reviews.Author: teopoulos
Reviews.Content: Never been to Barcelona before, we found the hotel through the internet, the location of the hotel is great, in the center but in a small alley good enough to avoid traffic and other city noises. The design of the hotel is great, very modern and very unique, the materials and the colors were perfectly matched and fitted from the lobby to the rooms. Breakfast didn't have many options, but had the basics and they were good. Wifi on the lobby for free was cool. The rooms had 30min free, if it would be best to have a longer room connection, but the lobby was very cosy to sit in and surf. Personel was very helpful and polite. Pricing was ok,nor cheap nor expensive. In general I would recomended it and I'll gladly stay there in my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and fantastic customer service!”
Reviews.Author: bocadey
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in the Hotel Denit and had a wonderful time. The location cannot be beat. It is two blocks from La Rambla and less than a fifteen-minute walk from the Gothic Quarter, but it is on a quiet and secluded little side street. The Denit staff are all incredibly helpful and friendly. They recommended restaurants and even made dinner reservations. The rooms are super cute and well-appointed. The shower had a tendency to get water absolutely everywhere, but that was in part because it was so good that it was in use for long durations. The only negative aspect was that the continental breakfast, while offering quite a bit of variety, was still a little underwhelming. We will definitely stay at Hotel Denit again on our next visit to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: celinatan68
Reviews.Content: The hotel's interior is tastefully done in a minimalistic way. Location is fantastic - very close to the airport bus drop off/pick up point as well as the heart of the shopping belt. The rooms are quiet despite the hotel's close proximity to the shopping area, food outlets and La Rambla. The Front desk staff, especially Laura, were very helpful and provided good follow up on our enquiry to Monserrat. We enjoyed our stay thoroughly and my girls loved the free internet available at the cosy and comfortable lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, nice people”
Reviews.Author: ILT186338
Reviews.Content: * Room was clean and quiet * Staff was friendly * Breakfast was basic but good * Further breakfast options like yoghurt, ham, eggs available (prices were reasonable) * Easy access to Metro * Bike rental next door * Cafés, Bars and Sightseeing in walking distance _ Internet access should be for free and not restricted to 30 min. per day

Reviews.Title: “A great value”
Reviews.Author: onthegogirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Denit prior to a cruise. It is a small hotel located on a narrow street just North of the Gothic District. The decor is decidedly modern. My room was comfortable and immaculate. The staff was uniformly friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast was included in the rate and everything offered was fresh and appealing looking. The very best thing about the hotel is it's location. It is a easy walk (five minutes) to the Placa Catalunya, La Rambla and the Gothic District. Mass transit and tourist buses are available at the Placa Cataluyna. There are abundant restaurants and cafes to enjoy and theaters are nearby. The only drawback is that the hotel is on a narrow alley that allows few vehicles. I had to wheel my bags down the alley when I arrived but the taxi driver took care of that when I left. As a solo woman of a certain age, I found the street a little intimidating at night but when I did venture out I had no problems at all. I found this property to be a great value and an outstanding location.

Reviews.Title: “All parts of the hotel briefed in two words . Tremendously wonderful”
Reviews.Author: bushinski
Reviews.Content: we arrived at the same day as the Pope so thats a good forerunner . the biggest luck on our 4 day trip was the magnificent wheather during our autumn trip to Barcelona . beside the wheather was also our lovely quiet hotel on a 1 minute walk from a very quiet alley to the most lively parts of the center of barcelona a big bonus. the rooms were clean and very stylish . you have to keep your room tidy , otherwise she will be to small and cluttered after a 4 days of shopping . but for the time you have to stay in your room it is certailnly big enough . the breakfast was good , we had bread,toast,muffins,croissants,ham and cheese , fresh fruit , juice.... richly enough for a good start of the day . if we wanted advice or god knows what else we could always find a sufficient answer . they where helpfull , friendly and had always time to help you on your way . the hotel is located on a 15 minute walk to the great busstation that brings you directly to girona airport fromwitch our ryannair plane toke off . if i have the chance to go back once in my lifetime i would definetly go back to the denit . we had for a rather small price a huge citytrip .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location but...................”
Reviews.Author: Lesley_Spain56
Reviews.Content: The location is very central and is perfect for a short visit to Barcelona. I had specially asked for twin beds when booking and also followed up this request by email. On arrival we were given a room with a double bed - and told that the following day it would be changed to twins. When told this was not acceptable to us we were then given another room. It is a very modern hotel with the bathroom facilities being part of the room - the wash basin is actually in the room with only a glass divider for the toilet and shower area. This set-up provides very little privacy when sharing. Considering the cost of the room we were somewhat surprised that only 30 minutes of free internet use was allowed before a charge was made. The breakfast was acceptable but lacked imagination - how easy for this to be remedied. I would summarise that you are really paying for the location of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Dennis_Alexander
Reviews.Content: This hotel met our requirements for a good-value hotel in a central location. Although the rooms were rather small, we liked the trendy boutique-style decor, and the staff were friendly and helpful. The location is unbeatable, down a side street just off the Plaça de Catalunya. The biggest drawback is the breakfast, which was disappointing, offering very little choice (bread, jam, fruit, cereals). A minor point - the room design may be very trendy, but the light switch was badly positioned at the head of the bed which meant I kept turning the main light on accidentally during the night!

Reviews.Title: “Unprofessional”
Reviews.Author: Javacat101
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel based on the reviews on tripadvisor - my preference being for small, modern, not on a main road etc. I booked the hotel on 2nd September 2010 and received a confirmation email (confirmation no. 208604) for the 13th - 15th October 2010. On arrival in the hotel we were told by the receptionist, that the hotel had been overbooked -- and we were offered a room in their sister hotel , the Inglaterra. On querying why this had happened we were told that morning the Denit received a group enquiry wanting all 20 rooms - so our room was given to the group and we were pushed out to stay at the Inglaterra (despite having our contact details they did not let us know this had happened until we arrived). We were told the Inglaterra had 'more stars' than the Denit and a 'better' breakfast as though this somehow compensated .As we explained had we wanted to stay at the Inglaterra, (large, dated and on a main road) we would have booked it, however we had little alternative (other than trying to find a different hotel) and so went to the Inglaterra. On returning to the Denit for some of our luggage (which in the meantime the receptionist had delivered to the Inglaterra) my husband met the manager who, whist he did apologise, said he 'must do what is best for the hotel'! As hotels rely upon the patronage of their customers this would seem to be a contradiction in terms and we have never encountered this policy in any other country we have travelled in. We will be registering our complaint with the Majestic Group, the Tourist Board of Catalunya and the Spanish Consumer Protection Body and most certainly would not consider staying with any hotel in this group anywhere in the world as their 'confirmation of booking' is not worth the paper it is written on!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, comfortable, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: hawkfan72
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Denit for one night prior to our cruise and one night after our cruise. We chose this hotel based on the positive reviews on Trip Advisor. We were very happy with our choice! This hotel could be described as minimilist -- very clean and comfortable at a moderate price. If you are looking for a fancy, luxury hotel and are willing to pay a lot, this may not be your choice. One of the best things about this hotel was the location. We were only two blocks from Place Catalunya, right in the heart of the action. It was super easy to get to-- we took the Aerobus from the airport, (which runs every 6 minutes for 5 Euros apiece). It stops at Place Catalunya, and we were able to walk the two blocks with our luggage. After dropping our bags, we were able to explore La Ramblas and the Gothic section on foot. In spite of the fact that we were in the heart of the action, we felt very safe. We did not have any issues with noise or any problems sleeping. Another plus about this hotel was the staff. They were all most helpful and accomodating. Also, we were happy to find we were allowed 30 minutes free internet access each day. Everyone has different preferences, but if you are looking for value and an excellent location, with cleanliness, comfort and a friendly staff, this is your place!

Reviews.Title: “Fun, Funky, Great vibe and scrumptious breakfast”
Reviews.Author: carvergrrrl
Reviews.Content: The hotel loacation is great - minutes from Les Crotes Ingles, major subway lines, Las Ramlas, etc. Breakfast was wonderful - even grabbed an apple for the road. Free wifi - YEAH! Only issue was that I requested a double for my husband and I and some how they had record that we wanted a single...could have been user error. Unfortunately, there was no double available but they were very sorry. They stored our bags for us all day and had no problem with us getting in and out (with shopping bags :).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: ggl70
Reviews.Content: It was great, the staff very helpful and nice. The only thing that was missing were hooks in the bathroom area by the sink and in the shower area, to hang up a robe and towels. Also, a separate switch for the each bedside light.. I loved the small notes about Barcelona all over the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I always will recommend Hotel Denit Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: C_Kazuto
Reviews.Content: A very nice place, helpful people, very well located. Everything was perfect. Congratulations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice choice at Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: dmc79
Reviews.Content: I booked 4 nights with breakfast for $99 each. When I arrived, they offered me an upgrade for $15 for each night. I did, cause I tough it worth because the huge diference about the room size. Location: very well located. One block from Catalunya Sq. When has a huge metro station and the stop from Aerobus ( bus from/to airport). One bolck from the Ramblas. Nice quite and narrow street. Room: amazing shower. Nice bed and confortable sheets. My only complain is that I tough the pillow isnt too soft. The tv has chanels from all over the world, except from Spain. Breakfast: poor. Didnt has jamon, cheese and croassant as shown on others reviews. They had: 3 types of bread (all bad), toaster didnt works well, orange and apple juice, cold milk, hot milk, coffee, the chocolate is only for hot milk, cereals, muffins and 2 types of fruit. Reception: great staff. Always there fir helping. My only complain is about info that they gave of value of taxi to airport. They said around $30. It was. But they didnt tell about the $7 airport tax and $1,50 for each luggage, I had 7!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: admiral7
Reviews.Content: Lovely clean and comfortable hotel right in the centre of things, with helpful friendly staff. The only let down was the breakfast, not much choice so we ate at a nearby patisserie on 2 mornings which had freshly squeezed orange juice and croissants with great coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in an unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: roblindag
Reviews.Content: Went for a Mum and daughter weekend and the best shops are dangerously near the hotel! Small and very smart, the rooms have everything needed including a fabulous triple size shower room. Tea making stuff would have put the icing on but not many places in Europe provide this wonderfully welcome facility! Breakfast is simple and good - worth having for ease as other places are the same price or more for less. The reception staff are very pleasant and helpful. Chosen from Tripadvisor, this hotel is great for the visitor wishing to see all the sights. It is a few minutes walk from the airport bus stop in Placa Catalunya. Very easy from the airport and costing €5 each - you get to see a bit of the city on the way! El Ramblas is 5 minutes away and an easy few minutes walk to the centre of the Gothic Quarter. The Gaudi houses which are a must see at night are also within walking distance.The Tour Bus leaves from Place Catalunya just a few minutes walk from the hotel but it's the main stop and the queues were horrendous when we were there. Our advice would be to have a very early breakfast on the day you plan to go on the tour bus and get to the bus stop before 10.00. The 2 loops on the bus are highly recommended! have a nice rest after a day on the hoof as we did. If you want free tapas - sit at the bar rather than tables. If you wish - ask for a checkout extension -if the room is not let that night they may give you an extra hour or so as they did for us.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was a pleasant surprise.”
Reviews.Author: Steph0312
Reviews.Content: Hotel Denit Barcelona was a very pleasant surprise. Taxi dropped us off at top of an alley and pointed down the way - we carried our luggage to the hotel (short walk) and walked into a very mod entrance. Rooms comfortable, everything decorated black and white, very up-beat atmosphere. Reception staff were excellent and very helpful. Location was great for walking to various areas.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic, but good location”
Reviews.Author: AnneTralee
Reviews.Content: The first thing that struck me about this hotel was the TINY bedroom (twin room). The sink is literally hidden behind a roller blind, and there is very little storage space for your things. The toilet/shower is behind a frosted glass door... Yes, you can see the silouhette of the person's EVERY MOVE, whether on the toilet, or in the shower!!!! No sound proofing AT ALL which was a little bit embarrassing!!! There was a tiny bit of a table, and a wooden 'Director's Chair', and that was it. There was also a flat screen television and air conditioning which was very necessary. My first reaction was to groan out loud, and we wanted to turn around and leave. Having said all that, it was spotless, beds very comfortable. The location was fantastic - literally a stone's throw from the Placa Catalunya, across the road from the department store El Corte Ingles, 2 minutes walk from the public airport shuttle which leaves every 10 minutes or so to every terminal at the airport, and we felt very safe, even though we had to walk down a laneway. About 200 metres away is the Hard Rock Cafe. There is no 'bar', even though you can order a drink or coffee at the reception. The breakfast (5 euros) was poor, only the bare continental (no cheeses or cold meats - a slice of bread, muffin, two choices of cereal and only coffee) - there is a Starbucks right behind the hotel and plenty other places to have breakfast very nearby so we ended up going to other places. This hotel is certainly not the type of hotel you'd want to stay in if you were on a romantic weekend - the walls are paper thin, we could hear every conversation from the people across the hallway, and then of course the glass door to the toilet/shower, but you just can't beat the location, and it is very clean. We had to check out at 12 but our flight was late at night. We did ask if we could keep the room for a little bit longer (they were not fully booked), but they were charging us over 50 euros for a few extra hours. They do have a luggage room though. I would stay in this hotel if all you needed was a place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful and clean”
Reviews.Author: xmoonlighterx
Reviews.Content: The Denit is in a great location and I really enjoyed my stay. Our room was cleaned everyday, electronic safe provided for free, breakfast was reasonable, staff was very friendly and spoke good English too. I would come back to this hotel if I was to visit Barcelona again as it was modern and central. The hotel is smoke free which was not a problem for me even though I'm a smoker....that says it all!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kat0chs
Reviews.Content: I loved the clean, modern look/feel of Hotel Denit. The location couldn't have been better. We wanted to be close to the famous Las Ramblas, but not near the noise and Hotel Denit fit that perfectly. It was down a nearby street (almost car-free due to its tiny size) that did get smelley on hot days. It looked like it got hosed down each day to help that problem. The room was on the small side which is typical in Europe, so not unexpected. It was modern and had a room safe, wonderful shower, air conditioning, and a flat screen TV where we managed to find a few English speaking channels. My only gripe is that there wasn't any space in the bathroom by the sink for me to put personal stuff like cosmetics or shaving stuff. We had to put them on the floor. We had the room on the main floor that was setup for disabled folks, so the shower was right in the main part of the bathroom with nothing dividing it from the rest of the bathroom. As a result everything would get wet when you took a shower, so you had to remove everything first to keep your cosmetics/shaving stuff from getting soaked. I had hoped to iron some rumpled clothes but they didn't have irons, only a laundry service that would've made it very expensive (approx 8 Euro for a blouse). The staff was very helpful, pleasant, and friendly. They kept our bags locked up in a back room on our last day so we could continue to sightsee until it was time for us to leave to catch our flight. We did not do the breakfast as we chose to eat elsewhere each day. I liked that they had free wireless available so I was able to connect via my iTouch at will. We did get to use the computer in the lobby, where we were allowed 30 minutes free each day. That was enough for us to get into some email and print out a confirmation we needed. Hotel Denit was a good place to stay and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a quick visit to Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: MoCro
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our 18yo only had 24 hrs for a first visit to Barcelona following a cruise. We wanted 1 room that would accomodate the 3 of us and found this hotel on TripAdvisor. It was fantastic. Can't praise it enough. It was a 10 euro cab ride from the port to the Plaza Catalunya and finding the hotel is a bit tricky - it's down an alley near the larger of the 2 El Cortes Ingles hotels in the plaza. But what a hidden gem! As others have noted, the rooms are small and IKEA-like, but very stylish and comfortable. They supplied a cot for my daughter that was very sleepable and the linens and everything in the room was super clean. Breakfast was included and excellent. The staff was very friendly and went out of their way to help our daughter who wanted a Barcelona World Cup jersey as a gift. We were there on a national holiday and many of the stores were closed, but they moved heaven and earth to help us find an open retailer. The Hotel Denit is the perfect launching pad for touristing and as others have noted, the bus to the airport is a stone's throw from the hotel with multiple buses lined up for the quick and cheap ride to the airport. The plaza is also a stop for the HopOnHopOff bus. We absolutely adored Barcelona and will definitely be back. This wouldn't be the right property for someone looking to lounge around a spacious room, but it's a cool and centrally located property with terrific service. We had a wonderful meal at La Tagliatella, Rhonda Universitat, 31 which is a 5-minute walk from the hotel across the plaza. It's a cozy Italian place with the sort of thin-crust pizza you'd kill for in the U.S.; delicious fresh pastas and a good and well-priced wine list. Portions are huge so order accordingly,

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: ktmills
Reviews.Content: Great location,easy to walk to all the hot spots in Barcelona, yet in a quiet alley to allow for good quiet sleeping. Beds are comfortable, breakfast was light, but good with a more extended ala carte menu for a reasonable fee. Staff was extremely helpful. Would recommend this to anyone traveling to Barcelona. We would stay here again if we return!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: wilkesk&P
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights with my brother and his girlfriend and to be honest we couldn't have chosed a better hotel . We selected it back in February from searching on trip advisor and at the time it was 11th of over 500 hotels in Barcelona so that was good enough for us. Location 10 out of 10, just off Placa de Catlunya which is the last stop of the airport coach (5Euros 5 cents single fare). Although the little street it was in had a lot of grafitti on the shutters when shops were closed we never felt uneasy or unsafe when going back to hotel day or night. As it is located on a traffic free side street it is so quiet at night you can't believe you are in the centre of Barcelona, especially with the top of Las Ramblas a 2 minute walk away. We ate out for all meals including breakfast as if you turn left out of the hotel there are loads of little eateries selling croissants etc which are ideal for a cheap breakfast. Rooms were extremely clean and comfortable- we had a wet room which did mean the floor was then wet when you wanted to go to the toilet. I pod dock was great, and flat screen sony tv on the wall too. Not much room to put clothes but on a short city break this wasn't too much of a problem. Only real downside was our room was very dark. It was at the back of the hotel and the only window overlooked an internal courtyard which also contained the windows of peoples flats so there was washing hanging out and even a childs bath suspended on a rope!!! Consequently not much natural light entered the room and when getting ready to go out & putting on makeup this was not great. We woud definately stay here again and would recommed it to friends and family with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “1st visit to Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: JoeCMaryland
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay, but the room amenities must be improved. There is nowhere to sit, except a desk chair that is like a beach chair, with flimsy support. There needs to be at least one comfortable chair for sitting in every room. Also, there should be a night light for getting up in the dark. The breakfast is very good. The reception staff is excellent. The cleaning staff is good, as well. Everyone is very cooperative and goes out of their way to accommodate guests. The Reception should take credit cards for tours, etc.

Reviews.Title: “trendy hotel in centre of town”
Reviews.Author: julieannboo
Reviews.Content: nice little hotel - two minutes from the main square where the airport bus drops off and five mins from la ramblas. in a quiet street but not scary at all. on the corner is a great coffee shop. sells the usual - crossiants, tea/coffee. where the locals go. the rooms are very white some might say this a bit clinical! we had a business room. air con, comfy beds. great sony tv. gripes were no tea/coffee maker or a fridge. also no alram clock either. these would be welcome additions. free safe and they had speakers for ipods! had to pay for internet in the lobby - would be nice if this was free. showers nice and powerful - very clean. sliding doors to shower/bath nice touch. sink in bedroom that felt a bit weird. 6 euros for breakfast - toast/cereal and tea/coffee included. bacon/sausage you had to pay 3 euros more. i felt that breakfast should be included on all room packages. hotel reception sells water for 3 euros, and small bottle of wine for 4 euros. hotel looks after your case when you check out. perfect for a city break in barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, modern, sleek, practical place with a GREAT location”
Reviews.Author: clwilliams30
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly, polite, and accommodating. Room were just the right amount of space for the price and were clean and modern. Walls a bit think so can occasionally hear neighbors and noise on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel , central and quiet !”
Reviews.Author: KAGOZ
Reviews.Content: A great central hotel perfectly located minutes away from the airport bus , metro and la Ramblas but in a small street with no traffic and very friendly help full english speaking staff. Quiet double glazed modern comfortable rooms, free computer and printer in the lobby and a perfectly sufficient breakfast. There is always silly little things you can pick on like no facial tissues or clocks/alarms in the rooms but over all a really good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant - ideal location”
Reviews.Author: unitedlancashire
Reviews.Content: Brilliant service from the receptionists to the cleaning staff Receptions were extremely welcoming and helpful Room was spotless every day, clean towels every day Ideal location and easy to find from the airport by bus.

Reviews.Title: “Really Great Staff and Location for a no frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: bluestarbutterfly
Reviews.Content: Hotel Denit, is in the perfect location just off the Placa de Catalunya and the meeting place of all the transportation plus in front of El Corte Ingles with a supermarket in the basement it's a great place to get supplies and buy picninc stuff, also just far enough away from the sometimes seedy La Rambla but close enough to everything. The Hotel is no frills, but super clean, good bed, and great shower and room has air. The staff is amazing, for a basic hotel, the staff really goes over and beyond. Laura was a huge help with finding great places to eat and all the staff offered great insider tips and places to see and where to find the best beaches (do not go to barceloneta it's seedy & a waste of time and ruins the magical mediterranean sea with all the people trying to sell and/or steal your stuff) head to the Selva de Mar stop on the yellow line and enjoy the beach with the locals). I have stayed at 5 star hotels that didn't have staff as pleasent as the Denit, really made our trip that much better. Thanks for a magical time in Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Can't imagine staying anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: ddsonthego
Reviews.Content: We just loved our four night stay at the end of July in this hotel. It is one small block form the most popular Placa in Barcelona. We were nervous when our taxi driver had to check with his maps and dispatcher for the location but we arrived with no problem. We enjoyed the decor, the shower (just point the sprayer towards the corner and you'll have no problems), the bed (at least a queen), the ipod base, and the A/C (it was over 90 degrees!). We did however miss an in-room safe (either our room -#57- did not have one or we couldn't find it), coffee maker, refridgerator and an English TV channel. Also, we had no noise issues and did not find the computer time limit a problem. We reserved a business double which was a nice size so we can't comment on the size of the other rooms. Also the staff was friendly and very accomodating. We did not use the breakfast special. We ate every morning down the street at a coffee shop - El Mos - coffee and croissant for 1.95 euro. (they also had desserts and sandwiches). Also it is very close the the Airport transport bus( 5.05 euro one way to the airport) which was very convenient. This location just can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Recommend hotel.”
Reviews.Author: dubtraveller34
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent b&b only hotel for a trip to Barcelona. Would endorse all positive comments from previous reviews. Very central but in very quiet street with no traffic and safe. Stayed for 7 nights in larger room. Very comfortable room with small but good shower room. Rooms well serviced every day and best towels have come across in any hotel. Safe in room useful and recommend use as Barca terrible place for pickpockets everywhere- on Ramblas, in metro etc. All staff helpful and friendly. Reasonable continental breakfast which we got for special rate of €5. Not worth official rate of €10 as there are plenty of cafes nearby where can spend €5 for breakfast. Plenty of restaurants within walking distance for eating out. Easy to use metro in city and good value. Have no hesitation in recommending hotel for short holiday stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and modern, but small rooms. Very small rooms. Very, very small.”
Reviews.Author: AdvisorKing
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Denit for one night. We are a family of four and were travelling through Europe for a month this summer. The rooms were booked for us, so we didn’t pay for them, but we did see that the room rate was 69 Euros per night. The check-in clerk was very friendly. Her English was far better than my daughter’s Spanish (which is far better than my Spanish). We were given two rooms, on separate floors. The rooms were the same size and were very small – perhaps 10 X 10 feet. Because my son and I were sharing a room, and the bed was similarly small, we slid the mattress off its foundation to create two “beds”. He slept on the mattress, I slept on the foundation. The two “halves” side by side (not end to end) took up the entire width of the room. There was a small amount of floor space at the foot of the bed. Overall, I’d say that the bed alone (when the mattress was still on top of it) took up about 40% of the room’s footprint. As this was the first stop of our vacation, I initially thought that perhaps this tiny room size was normal by European standards. However, our other accommodation on our trip was more in keeping with North American sizes. The rooms at the Hotel Denit were perhaps 20-25% the size of a typical North American hotel room. Another odd quirk was that the electricity in the room would not operate unless the room’s card-key was inserted into a slot in the wall. I presume this is a cost-savings measure that ensures that you don’t leave the lights on and the air-conditioning running while you’re out for the day. It wasn't a big problem but it had the potential to be inconvenient. On the positive side, the hotel could not be any closer to the centre of action. It is about a block to Catalunya Plaza, which is one of the main (and perhaps THE main) centres in Barcelona. From the Plaza you can access the subway/metro, tour busses, express airport bus, etc. Note that the hotel is on a very narrow street (so narrow that I’m not sure a car could actually fit). There are hundreds of these narrow streets in Barcelona and every one looks almost like a movie set! As a result, while the Hotel is in the centre of the action, there is no traffic or other street noise. We enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Denit. The rooms were very clean and ultra modern (glass and tile). As a family of four, even with two rooms, it was very small. I would recommend it, but with a very strong caveat about the size.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location, no frills, but clean and nice”
Reviews.Author: eil83
Reviews.Content: I chose Hotel Denit when booking because another reviewer said he was living in Barcelona and recommended to all his friends. It was a good choice. Hotel Denit is located in the best possible spot for a tourist visiting for only a few days. It was easy to get everywhere - and accessible by foot - in the city. The room was definitely small and minimalist (the "bathroom" becomes the shower and the sink is in the room) but it was nice and clean. The breakfast left much to be desired but the staff was friendly and free internet was available in the lobby

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is perfect”
Reviews.Author: ezm785
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the heart of the Gothic quarter, on a quiet old world street. It is designed with great intelligence and sensitivity, and has an aura of modern elegance. The staff was very upbeat and helpful, which always makes staying one's surroundings, more comforting and inviting. Actually, no complaints. Not a place for someone looking for "views," or a large establishment, but for simple and refined elegance, location, and price, one could not do better.

Reviews.Title: “Best holiday ever!”
Reviews.Author: Joijex
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and staff very caring and friendly. I ordered a non smoking room and the first room smell smoke, but the staff managed to give me another room without any problem and that one was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location and great service!”
Reviews.Author: lingo_uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Denit for 5 nights and had a very enjoyable time. The room: -Had a business room (superior double) which was large enough for us 3. There was plenty of storage for all of our clothes and suitcases. Also, the extra bed was very comfortable! -Had excellent extra features that you would not expect in a city hotel for this price- a plasma tv with plenty of channels, an ipod deck, a rain shower, air con, personal safe -Room was completely sound proof despite being in the centre of everything! -Lovely modern design The service: -Brilliant service from the receptionists to the cleaning staff -Receptions were extremely welcoming and helpful, providing us with maps and recommending us to restaurants, bars, clubs. They even searched on the net and called different places for us -Room was spotless every day Everything else: -Great lobby with free wifi-this is great if you bring your own laptop or smart phone -Fantastic location- surrounded by shops and cafes, 2 mins walk from the aerobus stop, 5 mins from 2 metro stops, 5 mins from las ramblas -Felt very safe in this hotel Overall we would like to thank Hotel Denit for contributing towards our fantastic trip in Barcelona- we will certainly be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Arriba Barcelona - totally fulfilled!”
Reviews.Author: MariaChery1111
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Placa Catalunya at 11pm thinking: how on earth are we going to find this hotel?! but nothing has been more easy, as it was just off the Placa! Arriving at the hotel we were really impressed with the decor and the very welcoming staff! The room - fantastic, AC, internet, power shower, iPod speakers, safe and super super clean! There is no fridge in the room, but the hotel staff happily took your food, ice packs or medicines into the hotel fridge and it was at your disposal every time. The service and presentation of the hotel was higher than i could have ever expected for it's surprisingly low star rating. The staff were really in the know as to what we could do, and had great recommendations for places to eat! Overall an absolutely perfect holiday and i would definitely return not only because Barcelona is such a fantastic city, but because thanks to this hotel, our stay was seamless and just perfect fun!

Reviews.Title: “Basically Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: amester57
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Denit last week for our Honeymoon in Barcelona and could not have been happier with our choice. The location is perfect - just a block away from the Placa de Catalunya and therefore the hub of all transportation - but on a side street so you do not have any of the noise. The Aerobus drops you a block away from the hotel and the Bus Touristic tour starts at the same place. Most sights are within walking distance or can be reached by a bus or metro from the Placa de Catalunya. The Hotel Denit itself is VERY clean and modern - my husband and I joked that we wish that we could afford to have a house designed in the same fashion. The room is large with a great shower and flat screen tv. The breakfast each morning was great for fueling up before a long day of sight-seeing. Although we did not take advantage of the free WiFi in our room, we used the WiFi in the lobby which always worked and was totally free. The staff is very friendly, knowledgeable, and helpful. The only complaint we had (and this is a VERY minor complaint) is that the hotel does not have an iron for its guests to use. But when you are on vacation in a beautiful place and not being able to iron is the worst of your troubles, I think you have it pretty good. Overall, we LOVED the Hotel Denit and would recommend it highly to anyone traveling to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: mcfKingston_Jamaica
Reviews.Content: Such a modern hotel - absolutely delightful. Receptionists were always friendly and helpful, night and day. Rooms were larger than expected and beds were surprisingly comfortable. Would definitely stay there again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Cherry_Wonderdog
Reviews.Content: I can’t say enough about Hotel Denit. I had done extensive research about this hotel and alternatives in travel books and TripAdvisor. My gut told me Denit would have the right combination of features, and I was spot on. Hotel Denit was our favorite lodging in our three-country European trip. Yes, the breakfast is a bit skimpy, but for 5 EUROS per person in advance – about the price of an ice cream cone, you really can’t complain! Instead, appreciate the hotel’s ideal location right of the Plaza Cataluña down a safe side street away from all the noise. There were other hotels I had considered which cost more but were located in very slummy areas far away from all this action. You can’t beat the location of this hotel, and unlike so many other downtown hotels, you can sleep at night too! Besides the location, there were so many things that the Hotel did right: the décor was funky, modern, yet also functional -- not too over the top. Our slightly larger “business” room (worth the premium) was plenty large for three people. There was a king-sized bed which actually consisted of two twins or full beds joined but with single sheets, covered by a VERY comfortable light comforter. There was a flat-screen TV attached to the wall next to a very functional A/C unit. However, our favorite part of the room was the bathroom shower combination. Sure, there’s no shower curtain, but this is clearly by design. There’s a sliding glass door that keeps water away from the main room, so it’s just a question of putting a floor mat near the toilet. Not a big deal, especially since the shower is by far the best we’ve ever experienced: ceiling unit spraying water with high intensity straight down like a true waterfall. We were taking two showers a day! Last but not least, the staff at this hotel is young, helpful, but not overbearing. Far more personable than in one of those larger hotels, but still a step beyond a single host or hostess you would find in a B&B. All in all, this was one of the better hotel finds of my entire life and I couldn’t imagine returning to Barcelona without staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: benn77
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a long weekend in Barcelona staying 3 nights in the hotel Denit. Its in a great location down a quiet side street in the Gothic Quarter just off La Rambla and Pl. Catalunya. We found it cheaper to book direct on the hotels website rather than through booking.com etc. This meant it was around €110 a night incl. breakfast for a business room. The room was spacious, modern and had everything you needed. Breakfast is basic but is everything you could need - cereals, fresh bread, fruit and muffins. The staff were helpful on restaurant choices and directions and I found on my return home I 'd left something valuable in the safe and they've found it and are returning it so service has been 5 stars! Other top tips for the stay.... Ciclo Barcelona - Great bike tour to see the sites with knowledgeable guides and for only €21 for a 3 hour tour Tapas 24 - Great modern tapas restaurant about 10 mins walk from the hotel Tapioles 53 - Amazing restaurant off the beaten track from the Para-lel stop. You need to book as there's only 6 tables! Ciudad Condal - Again great tapas with a great local feel‎

Reviews.Title: “Great central location”
Reviews.Author: Jenniemac
Reviews.Content: Very compact hotel, single rooms small but with great storage and very good bed. Staff very helpful. Daily change of towels etc. Hotel in old town of Barcelona and lots of interesting sights on doorstep.Would recommend location to anyone interested in sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, minimal but very very small.”
Reviews.Author: Linda X
Reviews.Content: I was very excited to get to Barcelona and stay at Hotel Denit. It really needs a bit of repainting. The best part about this hotel is the breakfast room downstairs. If you go, pay the little bit extra for the continental breakfast. Well-lit and and charming. Make your own Italian toast. Very lovely muffins, cheeses, apples, cerea. Our room was way too small for two people. We were travelling Europe for 2 months and there was not even enough room for 2 suitcases. I complained too late and was offered a different room but I was leaving early the next morning. Also the room was very, very dark which was annoying. I had to put my makeup on in the dark. The staff is really very sweet though and they try to be helpful. One VERY IMPORTANT NOTE: both the cab drivers that were called to bring us to this hotel could not find it on any map even after I gave them the complete address. They phoned dispatch a few times each and after travelling way out of our way charged us 23 euro when it should have been about 10. There are so many other great hotels around here....I probably would not return. Too dark and way way too small.

Reviews.Title: “Great little haven, wonderfully located.”
Reviews.Author: laingfamily
Reviews.Content: Denit measured up fully to our expectations. We liked the security, the location right near the Placa Catalunya, and the the escape it provided from the city noise and heat. The decor, modern and minimalist, was very effective, and the room was not cramped. Staff also very helpful, and a dinner visit to the 4 Cats, a couple of blocks away, a must!

Reviews.Title: “Sliding frosted glass door separating bedroom and bathroom!!!”
Reviews.Author: ruthyNorthernIreland
Reviews.Content: Hotel Denit is a very modern minimalistic hotel and ideal for people who like that kind of thing. The location was excellent in that it was very close to placa de Catalunya but from the outset it looks to be down a dodgy alleyway. The hotel staff were pleasant but not particularly warm and welcoming like other places. The hotel room was nice and clean amongst the sanitary white corriders and numerous doors. The room was small, we had a view out onto the alleyway previously mentioned with bags of rubbish and the odd homeless person. I was pretty disappointed with the style of the hotel but I would imagine some people might like it. The sink and vanity unit was part of the wardrobe in the bedroom and the toilet/ shower only had a sliding frosted glass door separating the bathroom and the bedroom AND it did not make a proper seal/ close completely, as I say, maybe some people may like that kind of thing. Also the walls were paper thin and you could literally make out what other people were saying in the next room. Otherwise it was a good value hotel in a convenient location but I will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “I would come again”
Reviews.Author: jason5566
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location. Excellent, attentive and professional staff. Clean as a whistle. Nice (included) breakfast). Rooms a little small but shower was great.

Reviews.Title: “Truly spectacular hotel with very little to work on”
Reviews.Author: OmarBaraka
Reviews.Content: I think that the hotel was great and every aspect worked together to make me want to stay at the hotel again but there was one small aspect that disappointed me... the internet. I would like to be able to access the internet through the sanctuary of my own room where I have privacy and I can stay on it as long as I please. But overall it was a great hotel and you wil definitely be seeing me again the next time I visit Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good modern hotel for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: TrixeeBelle
Reviews.Content: This is a good budget hotel for a few nights in Barcelona. The location was spot on for what we wanted – close to transport, it’s about 5 minutes walk to Placa Catalunya, which is a main metro train station and is where the airport buses stop, and the hotel was walking distance to pretty much everywhere. The front desk staff spoke English fluently and were very helpful with reservations, directions, and general sightseeing advice. Wireless internet was freely available from the lobby, but accessing it from the room required a new password every day, valid for only half an hour. The room itself was a double overlooking an internal courtyard with windows that opened out. The beds were a little problematic. As with most European hotels, the double was actually two singles, but unlike other places that made them up as a single bed, these were individually made, although there was only about an inch of space between them. When we complained to the staff, they said to just push them together. Not an ideal solution, but there wasn’t much else we could do. Unfortunately, the two beds were of different firmness, which felt weird when pushed together. We were also only given one pillow each, and the pillows were quite soft. The room was reasonably spacious, about 7x3m, plus a shower/toilet cubicle. The layout of the room was innovative - the vanity/sink was incorporated into the main room to maximise space, while the wet area was kept separate. It seemed to work reasonably well. The room had standard toiletries – shower gel, soap, shower cap, shampoo, and moisturiser. No tissues, and they only had one spare roll of toilet paper available at a time (most places have two spare rolls). One awesome feature, though, was the showerhead – big, beautiful rain-showerhead, resulting in truly blissful showers. The cleaners were good, but two points against them: they were quite inconsistent with replacing used toiletries, and they would start cleaning the rooms a lot earlier than we liked, so a few times they would knock on our doors to see if we were in and we had to send them away a couple of times. To be fair, the hotel didn’t provide “do not disturb” signs so it was hard for them to tell if we were in or not. The room was air conditioned, but it seemed to not work properly a couple of times. One bad thing about the room which we didn’t realise until a few days into our stay, was that the room had no fridge, which meant we couldn’t keep cold water or buy many foods from the markets. Not an issue if you’re only staying a couple of days, but it became an issue with our 10-night stay. Didn’t have the breakfast so can’t comment on that. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for a short stay, for a longer stay I would consider other options that included a fridge, better internet access, and a nicer “chill-out” environment.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service, and clean!”
Reviews.Author: mea2001
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a perfect location, it's located on a small street but at the same time it's right by La Ramblas as well as the Aerobus. You can save so much money by taking the Aerobus to and from the hotel (5.05 Euro at this time) versus around 25-35 Euro for a taxi. Don't be put off by the narrow street that it is on, it is very well-lit and safe and I was walking around 3am-5am after going to the clubs. Service is very friendly and English is well spoken. They are very nice people who work there. However you do get what you pay for, there is no ironing board, and it is very no-frills but it is clean and pretty. There is also NO INTERNET in the rooms. If you want to use wi-fi in the rooms you must pay for it, however it is free inside the lobby. I recommend you eat tapas at the Boqueria market every morning. For a quick and cheap lunch go to Maos vegetarian, and also instead of going to Las Ramblas everyday, make a left from the hotel and try the little bakeries and get some sandwiches there for a picnic. You can also take a bus straight to Parc Guell (highlight of my trip), and a bus straight to the beach from this location. Just ask the front desk which bus to take. Enjoy your stay in Barcelona! If you're looking for a supermarket, there is one on the lower level of Les Cortes Ingles right by the hotel, I saved so much money buying a gallon of water there and filling up my bottle everyday from my room.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel second visit and it was as good as the first visit”
Reviews.Author: LoisChadwick
Reviews.Content: Excellant Hotel all the staff are very helpfull, this was the second year we have stayed at this Hotel and it hasn't changed, Great location to see all the sights. Will be going again next year. Please do not change a thing. We have told all our friends about this Hotel and they all enjoyed their stay also.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean, and the staff was fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Debbie P
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Denit a few weeks ago. Great hotel, (think IKEA furnishings). Location was one block from Plaza Catalunya, where the Aerobus (really cheap) dropped us off. Easy to get back and forth from the airport. Terrific location, within walking distance of Barrio Gotico, Passeia de Gracia. The staff could not have been friendlier, more helpful. They were terrific. A little hard to find. Just look for the big department store, El Ingles Cortes, almost right behind it. Thanks for a great stay

Reviews.Title: “Great little place!”
Reviews.Author: ddranch
Reviews.Content: We just spent two nights at the Hotel Denit before departing on a cruise. The location is great...right near the main square and Las Ramblas...we walked everywhere and the sightseeing bus picks up nearby. Our flight was there very early in the morning and we were able to check our bags and do a little walking around before our room was ready at 11:30 AM. The first room we got was very smoky...just drenched in smoke smell, but we asked for another room and were moved right away. Make sure to ask for a non-smoking room. The rooms are very Ikea-like...but had what we needed. It was quiet and comfortable. The ladies at the front desk were always friendly and helpful. We didn't ever eat the breakfast there so cannot comment on that. The bathroom was small, but functional...although the lack of a shower door made things a bit wet. The bed was comfortable and had extra pillows. There plugs were for european outlets so we bought a cheap converter at a nearby electronics store. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service; don't try to drive there.”
Reviews.Author: Chisme
Reviews.Content: Denit is a fine small and inexpensive hotel in the heart of the Barri Gothic, a short walk from Placa Catalunya. "Walk" is the key word here: the hotel is located on a short one-way lane that is nigh-impossible to find the first time or to approach by car. The service is lovely - the staff goes out of its way to be helpful, making phone calls and providing Google maps for anything you might like to do. Rooms are at the same time stylish and basic and small, but very clean. The shower and toilet are in one glass enclosure, which is okay except that it is easy to trip and stub your toe: No markings for changes in floor level, and no grab bars. The sink is outside the enclosure, covered by a roll-up shade. Aside from a complete absence of hooks on the wall, nothing is lacking. Wifi is free in the lobby. Breakfast is OK but you can do better for less money at one of the terrific pastry shops a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: bonneylaketapps
Reviews.Content: A very good little hotel smack in the center of Barcelona. The street it is on is very quiet. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way - everyone was very pleased”
Reviews.Author: ewcarter36
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ideal for our purposes (small group of friends traveling together). The location is IDEAL - centrally located yet on a quiet street. We could walk to pretty much everything we wanted to see, as well as most of the nightlife. The hotel itself was wonderful - clean, lovely rooms, comfortable, quiet, very friendly and helpful staff, very good value for the money, etc. Everyone in our group loved the hotel! I would highly recommend it. I know some people on this site have complained about limited free wireless, but we just brought the laptop to the lobby and congregated there to discuss our dining options. Compared to the other hotels we stayed in on our trip, this was the best value - we were charged outrageous prices for internet in other places and it's really quite a gift that it is free here coupled with very reasonable prices for nice rooms.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: Meneldor
Reviews.Content: My wife and me stayed in Hotel Denit for 5 nights during Sonar, and really enjoyed our stay. The only thing which could be confusing is no free Wi-Fi in the rooms - only 30 mins free per day in the room or one has to go to the lobby.
