The minimalistic bathroom design is not so good - after taking a shower the lavatory pan is all wet, no (or almost no) walls between these two. The rest is perfect - the location (round the corner from Placa Catalunya), the soundproofing, the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect combination of price and quality”
Reviews.Author: moscow85
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff is very helpful, professional and friendly. The room was clean and nice. The location of the hotel is just perfect, very close to almost every place of interest in Barcelona. I will definitely stay here again and recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay!!”
Reviews.Author: AnnaUtrecht
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and supportive. We had a modern, clean, comfortable and quiet room at the back of the hotel. The view from the window was limited, but no problem for us. Beds are comfortable, and the bathroom is nice, with a good shower. The breakfast buffet is sufficient but don't expect cheese and meat. A good spot for your stay in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel, excellent value and wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: WEATraveler33
Reviews.Content: The Denit was wonderful, we had such a nice stay - everything was lovely, and especially *everyone* who works at reception was wonderful and so helpful. The hotel is right off of Placa Catalunya/La Rambla, Passeig de Gracia, etc., super central, very safe and well situated in terms of transport, including that it's right by the super cheap Airport Bus - can't get better than that. It's super clean, modern and efficient. It was a bit odd that there are no English TV channels at all (except for music videos), which is kind of unusual since there are a lot of other channels - I was hoping for at least BBC, to get some news. Also, totally not worth it to pay for breakfast, what's included is some bread and butter and jam - better off sampling great food in Barcelona for breakfast, for less money. We had a great time and a wonderful stay, and would definitely come back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Chic hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: mrsirin
Reviews.Content: The Denit's location allows easy walks to the Ramblas, the old city, shopping in the north, and many other places. There's a bike rental shop just up the alley with excellent, helpful staff that will help you plan great rides around the city. The Denit's young staff are very nice and helpful, and the hotel is super quiet. A few minor faults: the all white rooms and furnishings are starting to wear a bit: the walls, decorative pillows and canvas chair in my room all had some stains. Also, it seems wasteful to replace the soap every day when a guest is staying for multiple nights. Finally, the hotel's wi-fi is free only for 30 minutes a day. Other than that, it's a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: HBINDC
Reviews.Content: We found the Hotel Denit to be a very nice hotel - nice accomodations for a moderate price. Also a great location. We were there as part of our honeymoon and the Hotel provided a nice complimentary fruit basket and bottled water for us which we much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel in prime location”
Reviews.Author: andru86
Reviews.Content: Hotel Denit caters to every traveler with its ultra modern style with chic décor. The overall layout of the room may seem quite small, however, the bathroom and shower is allocated perfectly to make the room spacious. This hotel is ideally located for tourists as it is 2 minutes walking distance from Plaza Catalunya, where the tourist office is located, and is the hub of both metro and tourist buses. Yes, the location was perfect, the room was nice, but the most wonderful part of this establishment was the receptionist who thoroughly helped us out with our requests and gave good advice for our visit to the city. Being in early – mid 20s, my girlfriend and I always look to explore the nightlife and shopping. The receptionist (also in her early 20s) knew the hot spots of Barcelona, and introduced us with amazing venues (Opium, Shoko), and the best restaurant we have ever been to (Pla). She personally arranged the bookings and made reservations to these fine establishments so our night will go unspoilt, which I am very grateful for. Only downside about the hotel is the internet connection (30min free wifi in the room, otherwise free in the lobby), and lack of variety for the breakfast. But all in all, I recommend this hotel, and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice - Definitely would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: indofranco
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel for Barcelona. Location was perfect. Rooms were clean and nice. Staff was friendly. Free wifi in the lobby. Bathroom will not flood if you use the removable showerhead and a little bit of common sense. TV was a fun distraction (a lot of variety of channgels). I want to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Can´t beat the location and the decor and the friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: jmkcml
Reviews.Content: Free internet in lobby. Nice breakfast. Very comfortable beds and very quiet, given the location. Only problem was the lack of draining facilities in shower. Bathroom would flood without much effort. Great choice of tv channels. Was able to watch world cup in English, which was not possible in our four star hotel in Madrid. Lots of drawers and shelves to stow stuff, although room was pretty small.

Reviews.Title: “clever location”
Reviews.Author: Massimo T
Reviews.Content: First visit to Barcelona. The hotel location is very clever, close to everything. Room very clean, good bedding. Special thanks to Ziad for his kindness and to Cristina for suggesting to us a grea tapas restaurant, the Ciutat Comtal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location at Placa Catalunya”
Reviews.Author: r2020
Reviews.Content: Hotel Denit has a great location about a two minute walk from where the AeroBus drops you off at Placa Catalunya. We found the room very clean and the bed comfortable. My only warning is that the economy plus rooms are VERY SMALL. Ours was less than 10'x10' with a very small bathroom separated from the room with a sliding glass door. If we were going back we would get one of the business rooms just for some room to relax after a day's exploring. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful and there is a computer in the lobby where you get 30 mins of free internet daily. Breakfast is served downstairs and consists of coffee, juices, cereals, breads, and sliced meat and cheese -- we got a deal on breakfast for 5euro pp. which made the breakfast worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, friendly service, very quiet, extremely convenient location!”
Reviews.Author: NOTHERLAWOMAN
Reviews.Content: My husband, teenaged daughter and I stayed at Hotel Denit just a few days ago and had a very pleasant, comfortable stay. The room was very clean and although it was a bit of a squeeze with the 3 of us, it was well designed and equipped. We slept very well since it was super quiet with comfortable beds and the location was very convenient to everything....walking distance to all the "must see's" since it was located very close to Plaza Catalunya! Our room was cleaned but we never saw or heard the cleaning staff. We opted for the internet special breakfast and it was decent enough to keep us going till the afternoon (being vegetarians in Spain...not so easy!) All the recommendations that were made by the staff were bang on! If we ever return to Barcelona, we would definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean and modern”
Reviews.Author: BrianR82
Reviews.Content: I had the most enjoyable stay at the Hotel Denit, recently. The hotel has an incredibly warm and friendly staff and were very accomodating, keeping me informed about my stay ahead of my visit and making certain that I was well taken care of when I was there. The rooms were clean and well appointed with a very sleek and modern design and decorated in white. And, after a long day of travel and exploring, the beds were extremely comfortable and provided a welcome place to rest. The hotel was not in the very center of the Gothic quarter and slightly away from LaRambla where there is a lot of foot/street traffic, but this is a good thing. It is very close to Catalunya Plaza which is home to the tourism center, a police station, public transportation, taxi's and a stop for many of the tour buses. I also enjoyed the fact that there is an Aerobus which runs from BCN to Catalunya Plaza every 6-10 minutes for 5 euro's, about 100 yards from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location....rooms have some problems”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_07281
Reviews.Content: Hotel Denit is hip, modern, and is situated in a great location. However, our room had a mildew/mold problem due to a flaw in the shower design. Not sure if it was just our room or if other rooms had a similar problem. We had to keep the window open at nights to air out the room.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location”
Reviews.Author: scotaussie
Reviews.Content: Originally I booked 3 nights at a no change rate on their web site then had to change due to the ash. Hotel Denit were excellent and allowed me to cancel and then re book at no penalty. MANY THANKS FOR YOUR UNDERSTANDING. The hotel is located in an excellent location close to several Metro stops however if coming from the airport get the airport bus as it is safer and stops in the Place Catalyuna which is 5 minutes from the hotel. Hotel is minimalist ultra modern style which can get annoying like 1 chair, no stand for cases, no glasses and water from shower wets area in front of toilet. But room was comfortable and quiet which is the important thing. Breakfast was offerred as a web special for 5 euro so good value for a satisfactory selection. 30 minutes free WI FI or computer use in reception is available per day. Location is superb with easy walking to La Rambla, lots of restaurants and Tapas bars and metro to get to the sites. It is down a lane way so very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Modern decor, with spacious rooms, excellent location, but no good for sleeping!”
Reviews.Author: Gypsum
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that overall, we were happy with the hotel, but there were some negative aspects to it that I cannot avoid mentioning. The hotel's location is the best thing about it - absolutely perfect. It's easy to find, and you're right in the centre, but in a quiet, safe street - we had no problems at all walking back in the early hours of the morning. The hotel itself is very Ikea-ish (i.e. modern, basic, but in parts, quite stylish), and the reception area is spotlessly clean with nice contemporary decor. The staff were friendly enough, but nothing special. Our room (11) was lovely, and much more spacious than we'd anticipated, with plenty of storage space; however it was a little dark at times, even in spite of the light decor (although this was largely due to the fact that the hotel is in a narrow street, therefore the buildings opposite blocked out the light). The bathroom was nice and modern, with a wetroom-style shower and glass partition screen between that and the toilet. The sink was just outside it in the bedroom - this was not a problem at all. A big problem however, was the fact that every time we used the shower, the bathroom floor would get completely soaked, and we'd have to use two towels to mop up the water before we stepped on to the slippy floor - frustrating and a bit of a hazard which definitely needs revising - the partition screen is nowhere near sufficient to block the splashes. Another HUGE problem for us was the lack of soundproofing in the room. I'm not a light sleeper, at all, but I was woken every single night and morning by the sound of footsteps, doors, general chattering and, mainly, the sound of next door's shower, which sounded as though it was in our room - seriously, we heard everything from around the hotel and we had a bad night's sleep every single night of our stay as a result of this - massively disappointing because our first impression of the hotel was a good one; it seemed a calm sanctuary from the hustle and bustle of the city to relax in. Sadly, it was anything but, and we wouldn't stay here again because of this.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value; clean”
Reviews.Author: JL123456
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days - the location cannot be beat. Right at Playa de Catalunya - super convenient to transportation, especially the Airport bus. Rooms were clean although a bit on the smaller side. Bed were comfortable. We were on the 2nd floor (Floor 1 to them) and did not find the rooms soundproof. We heard everyone's door opening and closing on our floor as well as the elevator... every morning. There are some reviews here that the rooms have good soundproofing so i wonder if that's only an issue with the 2nd floor. 30 minutes free internet every day but you need to go to front desk for a code. The hotel had umbrellas available for guests when it was raining. Also, there was a small bookshelf where they provided and i suppose guests left some books so we were able to borrow some Barcelona travel guides while we were there. No minibar but they sell water and some drinks at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Cool retreat”
Reviews.Author: sekoval
Reviews.Content: The location and value of this hotel cannot be beat. Although in the center of the action, the rooms were very quiet and relaxing. Beds are very comfortable. 6 euro continental breakfast is a bargain. Only complaint is the layout of the bathroom where the shower gets the toilet area wet. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel in perfect safe central location”
Reviews.Author: spacelab29
Reviews.Content: Centrally located within 5 minutes to Playa Catalunya, metro, airport bus and many of the attractions. Rooms were very clean and soundproof, beds good and bathroom excellent. Staff were multilingual and very helpful. Location was perfect and we will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: mariaines1505
Reviews.Content: We (me and my parents) stayed in april for a considerable amount of nights. We found this hotel excellent in location! Especially for my parents, who were able to walk around most of the time with limited need of public transport. It also was a safe spot to stay, we were going out and coming back late at night without feeling unsafe. I have to mention the kindness of the staff particularly to my parents as they had problems with a short stay in Mallorca due to the ash cloud. They returned to Hotel Denit earlier than expected and it was no problem. They were always promptly to help and give great recommendations. The staff at the front desk and breakfast room were one of the kindest i have seen. Rooms were ok, but we didn't particularly like the bathroom distribution with the sink in the room. That was uncomfortable. The beds were a bit uncomfortable too, specially for us staying for more than one week. Another great improvement would be privide free wifi in the rooms, which a lot of other BCN hotels offer. I would definetly recommend this hotel, specially if you're a first time traveller to this wonderful city and if you are staying for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Gem Hotel in Convenient Location.”
Reviews.Author: dunndat
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to La Rambla, Gran Teatre Del Liceu, Palau De La Musica Catalana, Placa de Catalunya, Passeig de Gracia, and much more. You are right in the heart of the city with easy Metro access and yet comfortable, cozy and quiet if small rooms. The staff was very friendly, helpful, and English-speaking.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, friendly, well located hotel in Barcelona - highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: amyvf
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant and helpful hotel staff who responded to emails prior to the trip, greeted us warmly on arrival and helped with restaurant and entertainment recommendations. On arrival, they had upgraded the room we received and had left a personal note on the bed offering to assist with any questions we had. The room was very clean, modern and quiet. Excellent water pressure for a great shower! The hotel is excellently located close to La Ramblas (2 minutes walking), Passieg de Gracia (5 mintues walking), the Picasso Museum (20 minutes walking), and the Sagrada Familia (30 minutes walking). Barcelona is a wonderful city and Hotel Denit comes highly recommended as a base to explore it!

Reviews.Title: “A great, modern little hotel in a fantastic central location”
Reviews.Author: HornseyHobos
Reviews.Content: Hotel Denit is in a great location, just off Plaza Catalunya, right in the commercial and tourist centre of Barcelona. It's in an old building down a (mostly) pedestrianized street, but the interior has been designed in a very modern, minimalist style (lots of white walls and floors and pale wood). Our room looked out over the street but was really quiet (even with the window open through the night) and we got a great night's sleep. The reception staff were uniformly friendly and helpful. One minor complaint: we opted to have breakfast at the hotel, which we thought was barely worth the (admittedly cheap) €5 that they charge. There must be better places close by!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, well designed rooms, great service”
Reviews.Author: cathtei
Reviews.Content: for a more designer minimal hotel experience at a good price this is an excellent choice. Staff were very accommodating and although the location is very central..it is hidden away off the ramblas allowing for a quiet stay

Reviews.Title: “perfect location great service”
Reviews.Author: wovsaniker
Reviews.Content: for a tourist visiting Barcelona I think the perfect location to stay would be the Placa Catalunya. Hotel Denit is a block and a half away from there. The hotel is a three star hotel and is an excellent 3 star hotel and the staff is extremely accommodating and helpful. Definitely a great value

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in an fantastic city”
Reviews.Author: eahns
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location, staff, decor, service - one of the best hotels I've stayed in. The hotel was easy to find, immaculately presented (both the communal areas and our room), with extremely friendly and knowledgeable staff. The location was fantastic a short walk from everything. I would stay here again and recommend the hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hotel, excellent staff, superb location!”
Reviews.Author: bikibiki
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 6 nights. The hotel is a very good choice for travelers because it is situated next to Plaza Catalunya, which is the most convenient place as far as transportation is concerned (metro station, aerobus station, train station, touristic bus station) and in a walkable distance from many sights. It' s an excellent value for money choice, located in a quite street. The rooms (look like an IKEA advertisement) are not really spacious but they are comfortable and clean. The only peculiar thing is that the wash basin is in the bedroom. Ideal room for couples but the bathroom may be proved inconvenient for persons that are not intimate with each other. The staff is very helpful, polite, discrete and always willing to help you. We had no problem in communication because all the receptionists spoke English. It was a very good choice and if we will be back in Barcelona, we will choose it again!

Reviews.Title: “terrific value - great quiet location in a fabulous area!”
Reviews.Author: Jerseycouple_10
Reviews.Content: Service: Staff multi-lingual, had no language problems with our English! Arrived early from a cuise - (9:00 am), on Easter Sunday, and staff cheerfully secured our luggage since our room was not yet ready, and gave us the day to enjoy Barcelona. Fruit and bottled water on arrival were very nice touches! The personalized note was extra special. Staff was very pleasant, helpful, accommodating, and gave us a wonderful restaurant recommendation for Tapas. Breakfast each morning was very nice, fresh, and with good choices. Information on Barcelona in hotel room helpful. Room: comfortable bed, could have used another set of bed pillows (we didn't ask, tho), and we were not comfortable with the decorative accent pillows on the bed that were there for all the previous guests - they had wine stains on them, and something with a covering that could be washed between guests would have been preferred. We were not comfortable using those decorative accent pillows. Storage area for clothes was convenient and adequate. Nicely done (and hidden!)! Storage safe very handy. Air conditioner worked once we had directions from the front desk - directions in the room might be helpful. Likewise for a TV channel line up. Took us awhile to figure out the English speaking channels on Analog. Bathroom: Very nice, large absorbant towels replaced daily, and beautifully done! Face towels / wash clothes would be nice. The translucent glass was very attractive. Hairdryer, shampoos, conditioners, all provided. Might consider an extra bar of soap, as the soap seemed to run out / dissolve very quickly. Location: Located on a quiet side street, yet centrally located - one block off Las Ramblas. We never heard noise, or traffic! Close to shops, restaurants, and transportation. Took the public AERO bus back to airport for 5 euros - 30 minute trip - we only had to wheel our luggage about 1,000 yards to the AERO bus, and this was so worth it. Likewise, close to public transport, buses, metro, at Placa de Catalunya. We would happily come back!

Reviews.Title: “WOULD RATHER KEEP THIS HOTEL AS A SECRET”
Reviews.Author: RanAustralia
Reviews.Content: But i initially found out about the Denit via tripadvisor so i think it's best i also share my experience. If you are looking for a 3 star hotel that is very clean ,in a great quiet location,(only 1 minute walk to Plaza Catalunya) groovy/modern,free internet in the lobby then this is what i would call your value pack.My wife and i stayed here for a night and loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: AuldReekieLass
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at the Denit based on its location and previous good reviews on Trip Advisor - and we certainly weren't disappointed on either count. The hotel is in the ideal location for exploring Barcelona, less than two minutes walk from the Ramblas and the Gothic Quarter, and very handy for several metro stations, meaning every part of the city was accessible within minutes. The rooms were clean and comfortable and reasonably sized for a big European city and the shower was fabulous! The rooms were also quiet at night, which is a big plus, and, since the main purpose of our trip to Barcelona was to see FCB play, I loved that they had Barca TV in the rooms, despite not being able to understand it!! The staff were extremely friendly and helpful and spoke excellent English, and the free 30 minutes internet access per day was much appreciated when we wanted to investigate a trip to Girona. All in all, it was a superb trip and the Denit played a big part in that. We'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “All that is required for a short stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: ageena
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff, fantastic position close to Placa Catalunya. Clean, modern, everything works, small but compact.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel although lacks some basics”
Reviews.Author: steve5312
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Denit over the Easter break. Situated in the centre of Barcelona right next to the Catalunya Square, it's ideal for everything from the airport bus drop off point to the tour bus hop-on stop, to being at the general epicentre of the city. Being down an alleyway off the main drag, it's also very quiet, which meant we slept well on all three nights we were there. The hotel itself is decorated in beautiful boutique style - minimalist white everywhere. The staff were very friendly and the public areas spotless. A lot of effort obviously goes into keeping the place "just right". My only (small) complaints would be with the poorly designed shower/toilet area which floods easily, although I guess there's not much they can do about that now, and the absence of kettle, coffee or glasses in the room. We were provided with an iPod docking station, which was a bit of a "cool boutique" gesture when actually I would have rather had something to make a coffee with when I woke up and something to drink water out of. I'll write to them to suggest it anyway. I strongly advise you to book a higher grade than the "economy" room, which cost me 140 euros a night for two-person occupancy. The room was very small and if I'd known quite how small it would be then I would've spent more money on something bigger. However, these were only minor irritations during an otherwise good stay. I would recommend the Denit, and I can't fault it for cleanliness, friendliness, design and location.

Reviews.Title: “Well-priced hotel in an unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: CQ2007
Reviews.Content: Hotel Denit is conveniently located about 2 minutes from the Aerobus stop in Plaza Catalunya. It is located in a very quiet side street (next to Portal de Angel) across from El Corte Ingles. Las Ramblas isonly about 3 min walk from the hotel. The hotel is very clean. The rooms are equipped with a flat screen TV, hair blower, and a safe. They offer housekeeping at no charge. Since the rooms are not equipped with a minibar or a water heater, hot water and ice are available at the lobby at no charge. WiFi is also available 24/7 for free at the lobby. There is also a computer station with a printer in the lobby that hotel guests can use for free. Breakfast is served in the basement- they offer jamon, cheese, fruits, cereals, bread, milk and juices. It's very good value for 5 euros. But the selection can be quiet tiring after a couple of days. Overall, the hotel is very good value. It's a well-priced hotel in an unbeatable location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location, helpful and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MissPinky077
Reviews.Content: I have recently returned from Barcelona, and if i was to suggest a hotel, that would definitely be hotel Denit. 2 minutes walk away from Placa Catalunya and 3 from Las Ramblas. You are actually in the center of everything: metro stations, touristic buses and transportation to/from the airport, everything is there. The rooms are not very big, but they are clean, and if you are in a city like Barcelona, there are millions of places to visit so the size of the room will not be a problem. I loved it's modern, minimal decoration. The staff was very helpful and we were always given the best directions and information. Thank you for your hospitality. I hope to return to hotel Denit again, soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: JACKTHETRAVELBUG
Reviews.Content: Booked on the internet and spent 6 nights here. The day of our departure from the US received an e mail from the Denit that offered a 50% discount on breakfast because we booked on the internet. Good deal as breakfast was a complete European selection. Small extra for Cappucinno or eggs. The hot milk for the coffee has a weird taste and is probably canned or irradiated. so bring your own half & half. The bath floor does get soaked as a previous reviewer indicated. Bring shower shoes. No glasses in the bathroom, ask for them at the front desk. If you don't like white don't stay here as everything is plain, minimalistic, white with linoleum floors. Linoleum floors in a country famous for tile and stone. The manager called as I was checking in to suggested that after the first night I could move to the 5 star Majestic Hotel, another in their group, for the same price (my choice). I preferred the location of the Denit so stayed there. I was in the lobby when another couple checked in and they were told that they could either have two single rooms or stay at the Majestic so there must be a glitch in the reservation system. Wi Fi in the lobby 24/7 worked great with my Blackberry. The staff is very helpful and pleasant and English is well spoken here.

Reviews.Title: “Central, quiet, new, very helpful personnel - what more do you need?”
Reviews.Author: Rank0
Reviews.Content: It was the first visit to Barcelona for our family of four. I did my research concerning the accomodation, I chose Denit and got everything I expected. All four of us were more than happy with the hotel. Staying in the strict center of the city and yet in a quiet pedestrian street is a combination that is really hard to find. If you are not to much interested in luxury, this is the best place to stay. Barcelona is really a fantastic city and we like it very much. Howver, buy a ticket for Barca match only at their official box! Ranko from Croatia

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Serol
Reviews.Content: We have back today to Israel and stayed at the hotel for one week, the hotel is at a great location, clean and very warm rooms, very kind and helpful stuff, everything we asked for and even more! Special thanks for the reception for the patience and all the help!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient, and cute”
Reviews.Author: naomi2291
Reviews.Content: Hotel Denit was a good choice for us for our 3 nights in Barcelona. We took the Aerobus from and to the airport for only 8 Euros each round trip and walked to the hotel which is only one block off of Plaza Cataluna. Again the Bus Touristica is only one block away and we got off in the Gothic Quarter to eat and walked a few blocks north to Hotel Denit. Location was superb. The rooms were very clean and towels soft and fluffy, beds comfortable. Only quibble is that the shower has only a half partition so the toilet area gets wet as does the bath mat. internet access is only 30 minutes a day unless you use your own computer in the lobby.We had a terrific time in Barcelona as the architecture is astounding and the tapas and drinks make for a convivial evening. Have fun.

Reviews.Title: “So happy we chose this hotel to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Aretich
Reviews.Content: This is one of the hotels we have enjoyed most. Clean, beautifully decorated, in a perfect location, with very kind and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Ideal Location!”
Reviews.Author: Matty-G84
Reviews.Content: First time traveller to Barcelona, stayed at Denit for 3 nights. Ideal location, just off Las Ramblas and Plaça de Catalunya. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay here, all staff really friendly. Room was spotless, will be returning here for certain when i return to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: kevco33
Reviews.Content: The location of this property is smack in the middle of everything about Barcelona. Although the single room was small, it was well furnished, have a great shower and an ipod docking station. I did have to call down to Reception to ask that they contact another room as they were making a real noise, but on the whole it is very quiet. I would have NO hesitation to either recommending this or staying here again - well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: r88my
Reviews.Content: As others have mentioned, if IKEA did hotels... This is a thoroughly modern and stylish hotel. The most important aspect of a hotel for me is cleanliness and good service, of which this had both. It only has about 4-6 rooms per floor so never felt too overcrowded. The rooms were probably the largest I have ever stayed in. There was free wireless internet. The only thing I found very odd was the sink being outside the bathroom in your room. The location is spot on for Barcelona (been there 3 times) just at the top of the Ramblas on a side street in the main square. Note that the taxi will drop you off at the head of the street as it is pedestrian but rest assured it is completely fine. The hotel was very quiet too. I thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, Clean, Pleasant, and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: ksetzer
Reviews.Content: A fantastic location a few short blocks (far enough to make it quiet, close enough to be convenient) from La Rambla and Plaça Catalunya. Rooms are modern and fresh. While basic, they are not spartan. they have an inviting modern design that does not fight visually with all of the more whimsical architecture you will see while in Barcelona. All staff I encountered were quite friendly and helpful. I'll definitely return to this hotel on my next trip to BCN.

Reviews.Title: “very clean room, value for money, great location”
Reviews.Author: missytung
Reviews.Content: rooms are neat and tidy. room size is not that huge but this is typical of european hotels. nothing very fancy of the room so dont expect too much but this is what you paid for. the basic necessities (towels, bath gels, soap) are available so it's good enough. location is great. everything is walking distance away - las ramblas, boqueria, gothic cathedral, aerobus to/fro airport, metro train station and food. we booked the rooms during its promotion so it's really value for money! take the business double room as this is bigger. downside is no free internet and the shower is linked to toilet. so you normally end up with very wet floor all the way to the toilet after using the shower.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: luccaDublin
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. first time to barcelona, excellent hotel, modern,clean,affordable& friendly. could not be a better location.very very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Hip, modern, well-designed hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: frankef
Reviews.Content: Superb, quiet location, tucked in a pedestrian side street -- easy walk with luggage to Aerobus and Metro at Plaza de Catalunya, convenient to La Rambla and Gothic Quarter. Very helpful and friendly young English-speaking staff. Good breakfast. Rooms are small but efficiently laid out, with enough storage. Minimalist decor may put off some folks, but it fits with Barcelona -- young, hip, stylish, and design-conscious. Good bathroom with Grohe fixtures. In-room safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Bartcock
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very functional and perfectly located in Barcelona. Nothing fancy but rooms were of adequate size and very modernly decorated. Views out of our window were a bit unusual as you appeared to look directly into some apartments of large families complete with laundry drying on lines. Very quiet though and you couldn't hear any outside noise. Staff was very helpful with recommendations for restaurants and getting taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: g00217810
Reviews.Content: Just a very brief summary: Rooms are basic but clean and well presented. Superb location - practically on Pl de Catalunya Helpful & friendly staff Walking distance of shopping & nightlife Will use again should i return to Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Excellent design of small rooms to make them comfortable and very clean.”
Reviews.Author: traveller20102010
Reviews.Content: The service was responsive, the rooms very functional and funky. Despite requesting in advance they weren't able to give us interconnecting rooms but they moved things around so we could have rooms on the same floor. We would definitely return, primarily as the location is so good and the rooms work well for our needs. The only criticism I have is that breakfast was pretty basic and for the first half of the stay, the croissants (the only thing I wanted to eat) were burnt!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: AnshulG
Reviews.Content: We went down to spend Christmas in Barcelona, and picked up this hotel based on the reviews on TA. And as always, the reviews gave a correct representation of what to expect. We were surely not disappointed. Hotel Denit comes with a perfect location, at a stone's throw from the Catalunya underground station, and from the main part of La Ramblas. Lots of places to eat and drink till quite late in the evening, gave us more time to go around. The staff were courteous and tried their best to ensure that language is not a problem. Breakfast was not included in our reservation, but at Eur6 pp it was a good start to the day (though the BF lady was not prompt at refilling things). The room was a bit small to my taste, specially the shower and WC. The drainage of the WC was not perfect and it made the entire area a bit messy. There were enough English channels on TV, and the other features like AC, city brochures were in place. I missed a minibar and extra towels but to be fair, that was beyond the budget that Denit offers. Overall, I really enjoyed my stay in Denit, specially due to the location at the moderate cost (Eur80 per day exc BF).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: chitowngatorgirl
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here about a month ago and had a wonderful experience! The staff was so extremely helpful with directions, restaurants and bars that we couldn't have had a better time! It's in a great location, so close to everything. The only part that was at all annoying was trying to find it at first. We didn't realize it was down a side street so we wandered for a bit, but found it fairly quickly. The rooms are decent size and really clean! I would definitely stay here on my next trip to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice in Barcelona...”
Reviews.Author: rubenj
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 11 nights. Excellent new hotel. Staff is outstandingly helpful and always very courteous and friendly. Not much choices on Buffet Breakfast, but still good for the money. Location is perfect, a block from plaza Catalunya on a quiet street, so you can sleep at night. Definitely would stay there again on my return to Barcelona and would very much recommend it to anyone looking for a centric hotel. Two things for improvements: get a fitness center, internet access would be better if free at rooms (only 30min free per day, free at lobby).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location. Helpful staff. No street noise but if door slamming wakes you...”
Reviews.Author: floradivine
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend in early November and were very happy with the hotel. Luckily, I knew it was located on a hidden street, so we had little trouble finding it. I also knew, thankfully, that we had to insert our room key-card into the slot in order for the lights and air conditioner to work. The location could not be better. We walked everywhere - and I mean everywhere - from this hotel. It was very clean, modern and white. Felt a bit like an Ikea showroom, actually. The bathroom door is frosted so it offers a bit more privacy in the shower than many of the other hotels' showers, which was good, as I shared the room with a co-worker/friend. The beds were very comfortable. We laughed every time we put the shade up and down because the pull-cord made so much noise and took a long time to move the shade - I don't know who would design such a crazy thing. The view from our room (#14) was awful, but we weren't really looking for a great view, as we were only there to sleep. We couldn't hear any outside noise at all, because the hotel is on more of an alley than a street, and our room was on the back side. My only complaint is that our room was right next to a maintenance closet, which was opened and closed many times each morning. Every time the door slammed, I woke up. Honestly, all the doors slam loudly, so if you're a light sleeper, this could be a problem. It was for me. There was construction on the surface of the alley/street while we were there, which was a bit of an eyesore, but by the end of the week the whole street will have nice tiles. As others on TripAdvisor have mentioned, you get only 30 minutes a day of free wireless, but we weren't there to be on Facebook or to work. We did not get the breakfast at the hotel. There are many places nearby for breakfast. Everyone we spoke to at the front desk was very helpful. Thank you especially to Cynthia and Davide who answered a lot of questions for us. There's no official concierge like many of the larger hotels, but the front desk staff performed all duties a concierge would. I would stay at Denit again without thinking twice.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Denit - what a great find in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Cameroni
Reviews.Content: Great location on a side street only seconds walk to Plaza Catalunya / La Rambla. No noise so you can enjoy a great nights sleep. Hotel very modern with good sized room (spotless) with comfortable beds. Helpful bi-lingual staff with good advice on things to do/places to visit. Walking distance to airport bus and metro links (1 min). No iron/ironing board facilities in hotel. Wouldn't recommend it for business use as no wi-fi/internet connections in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: steve_mcdonald64
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent. It is five minutes walk from the airport bus stop in Placa de Catalunya which is the centre of all activity in Barcelona giving convenient access to all tourist attractions. It is on a pedestrianised street so you will still have 50 mtrs walk even if you have a taxi. It is ultra modern, spotlessly clean and the staff are friendly and helpfull. Breakfast is a bit limited and repetative but is fine for a short stay - it is after all bed and breakfast accommodation not a full blown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: dillon2158
Reviews.Content: Hotel Denit is in a central location, just off the Placa de Catalunya. The airport bus and tour buses all stop in the Placa so you only walk a short distance to your hotel, shops, etc. I was a bit disappointed when I turned into the street as unfortunately the road surface had been removed and a new surface of stone blocks was being laid. Once finished, middle of November, the whole street can be cleaned to remove the dust. At the hotel we were always greeted by very friendly staff who are able to offer advice about buses, etc. 30mins free access to the internet was available using the visitors computers at reception. Rooms were clean, quiet and accessible by stairs or lift. There was a mix up over the rooms booked so we were compensated with free breakfasts which were very good (included fresh fruits, juices, breads and plenty of coffee). Dont worry about booking single rooms. They are usually very small with uncomfortable beds so I had booked doubles but next time I will think seriously about booking singles as they were roomy with wide beds. I will definitely visit Barcelona again, 5 days were not enough, and I will book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “SERVICE AND STUFF WONDERFULL.”
Reviews.Author: carlavanessa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for our honeymoon and we were very happy. The Hotel Denit is perfectly located in Barcelona downtown area just 2 minutes From Placa Catalunya and next to a big department store called "El Corte Inglés" were you can find ALL i , everything you need yoy can get it there :). We found the hotel itself really cosy and the staff very polite and friendly included the ladies from Breakfast area and Housekeeping service also. Our room was fantastic , the hotel staff left a surprise for us in the room. When we came in (it was part of our honeymoon) : a good "cava" (catalan champaigne),chocolates, two bottles of romantic body oils and a special card made by the front desk staff. THANKS A LOT FOR THE DETAIL! We had a very enjoyable stay in Hotel Denit and we would be very happy to come back again to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate all white boutique hotel, well thought-out, central location”
Reviews.Author: donderhill
Reviews.Content: I doubt you can do better than this, for a sleek, modern, but unpretensious hotel, really a b&b,a stone's throw from the Plaza Catalunia and the Ramblas. Not accesible by car, but parking nearby. Only let-down the breakfast (cynical buffet, when they could do something simple of a quality that matches their aspiration) and the coffee which is unspeakable (why not buy an Italian expresso machine?) Loved our stay.

Reviews.Title: “keep looking”
Reviews.Author: toxicmd
Reviews.Content: Small hotel located in the old city but inconveniently on an inaccessible street - the hotel made no provision for parking leaving us to find a commercial lot at 36 eros per night and the need to haul bags to and from the hotel. The advertised free WiFI turned out to be limited to 1/2 hours per day. The overall price of the room ended up being the same or more than other area hotels. The rooms are small even by European standards. The staff was monolingual and hence mostly unintelligible unless you speak spanish. We didn't try the breakfast, but why would you with a Starbucks nearby. Next time we'll probably look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and very helpful staff....”
Reviews.Author: seaitall
Reviews.Content: Right behind the La Rambla, new and trendy. The staff was fantastic, very friendly and helpfull, breakfast is good and the location is the best!!!. All in all we are very happy with our choice. We realize, that this is Barcelona and the space is at premium. Our room was on the 5th floor, bright, but quite small with limitted cupboard space. We were living from our suitcases. On our arrival, the floors were not very clean, especially the bathroom. There was no fridge or tea kettle. But again, for the price we have paid, no complains.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful, modern, clean hotel in the centre of the city.”
Reviews.Author: NenaghHeritage
Reviews.Content: Very relaxed, modern, clean hotel with friendly and helpful staff. Great value for money with good breakfast and free internet use at Reception. Excellent location - less than 5 minutes walk to Playa Catalunya and the pick up point for the city tour buses. 5 minutes walk to La Rambla.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: PattiP_01
Reviews.Content: We arrived at hotel Denit at 11.30 on a Saturday evening desperate to find a hotel room since the apartment we had booked was just awful. We were referred there by the receptionist at Hotel Inglaterra (which belongs to the same group). We had had a horrible experience with the person who had met us with the keys to the apartment and we were immediately struck by how lovely and clean the hotel was and how helful, friendly and welcoming the night porter was. Our initial room was rather small, but beautifully appointed. The next day we moved to a larger room and stayed for the full week. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. The staff were great! Very helpful, friendly and informative. The hotel is in a superb position near all the night life and close to Placa Catalunya and the Tourist busses, but is in a very quiet street.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: SimonaRome
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Denit Hotel for four nights in August 2009. From Placa Catalunya station, it is a two minutes by walking (downtown area). The hotel itself is REALLY LOVELY, It's a great place to relax with fabulous attentive staff and bright, clean , modern rooms. All the staff were all very friendly and happy to help with directions and recomanations. The room was really clean and cosy and had ammenities extras (all wrapped) such as a sweet each evening, tissues, a toothbrush and a comb. My room had a balcony with a small table and we could get some drinks there, it was really fantastic!! We had a very enjoyable stay there and we would be very happy to come back again :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, service and location. Couldn't have been happier.”
Reviews.Author: kingciaran
Reviews.Content: A sign on the main road to show the alley which the hotel is on would be helpful and your website description of the hotel does not adequately show how excellent the location is. Also clients should be informed of the extra services such as the discount on the tour bus etc. The ipod players are a great extra. Everything is very new and kept clean.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and tranquil for a much much needed recharge after a busy Barcelona day!!”
Reviews.Author: spike007Sydney
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on the internet and after a dismal experience in Paris were somewhat sceptical....but were thoroughly delighted with what we found on arrival! A new fresh hotel with superb and helpful staff who assisted us with last minute changes to our tight schedule. They ensured that our time was well spent with recommendations for places to see and eat...all of them successful....and even held our luggage for a couple of days while we ventured outside of Barcelona until we returned. The breakfast (included) was plentiful with fresh breads and fruit and a great way to start our day. Thoroughly recommend this hotel for its location style and and thoughful assistance to us during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect short break”
Reviews.Author: tug0
Reviews.Content: Hotel ideally situated in old part of the city in quiet street but only minutes from La Rambla and main square & amenities. Rooms modern, clean & comfortable, staff very helpful. Breakfast adequate. Will definitely use hotel again & recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable & affordable hotel in heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: 1Saloni
Reviews.Content: My sister & I were really enjoyed our holiday in Barcelona & Hotel Denit helped make our stay a success. Its location near Placa Catalunya & La Ramblas meant it was ideally located to catch the Metro & walk to the gothic quarter. It was well located when looking for restaurants nearby for dinner. The rooms were in the modern minimalist style & were clean and comfortable. The staff were helpful and friendly throughout our stay. The continental breakfast was a substantial affair in our opinion; the staff made sure that nothing ran out. And given the price, I would say it's a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and affordable hotel”
Reviews.Author: william16
Reviews.Content: I throughly enjoyed this hotel considering the price. Everyone spoke good english and were very helpful. Stayed in a business bedroom and loved the design, very slick! It was clean, with a modern, simple and well though-out furnishing. The location was great too, at the edge of Barri Gotic almost next to Plaza de Cataluna. Considering the price, I can definitely recommend this hotel. There are only a couple of bad things I could mention. First, regarding the location, the hotel is in a alley (nothing strange about that, Barri Gotic is from the gothic era and is full of picturesque alleys everywhere) which has a bad smell. Inside the hotel you will not notice it, so it is not a big deal. Secondly, internet access is only free 24/7 in the lobby/lounge via wifi provided you use your own laptop. Otherwise you get free internet access for only 30 minutes using the computers in the lobby or your laptop in the bedroom. If you need more time, it costs (staying in a business bedroom made no difference in this regard), and you will need to have a working mobile phone to receive a code sent via a SMS message so you can login.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: ilovecalvin
Reviews.Content: Hotel Denit was at a great location, in the heart of Placa Catalunya. You have the convenience of hopping on the metro, bus, aerobus, and all the tourist bus in a matter of a few minutes. The hotel in itself was trendy and clean. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. There were few things I wish they had, such as a towel bar for the smaller towels, but these became trivial since we didn't spend much time in the hotel. The breakfast food was at best okay but enough to get your started until lunch time. The best part about the experience was the price. Prior to our Barcelona trip, we were in Paris. Our room at Denit was probably 1.5 times bigger than the one in Paris, but 40 euros less per night. We stayed in a double plus, which was big enough to open 2 large suitcases comfortably and enough storage for clothes. Each customer was allowed 30 minutes of free internet each day during your stay with the computer ONLY in the lobby. Of course, free wifi would have been more ideal but we never had to wait for the computer downstairs. There is an option of wifi with a price. I would highly recommend this hotel. Location is premium and VERY VERY convenient. The aerobus is right around the corner and only 30-40 minutes away from the airport. Can't beat that. I'm sure you can find a more luxurious hotel in town, but it's hard to find one at an affordable price at an ideal location with a spacious room.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, central location near many of the main tourist sites, great price,”
Reviews.Author: aduane
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel Denit in Aug 2009 for 5 nights. From the moment I checked in to the moment I checked out, it was a pleasant experience. The staff were very friendly and the buffet breakfast was ideal. My single room was compact but perfect for my stay and it was well equipped. The hotel is noise free as it is off the main street. Only 2 minutes to Las Ramblas and many other major sites are within minutes walking distance including the great market area and the Gothic quarter. Metro Catalunya (green line) is only 2 mins walk also. Placa de Catalunya is just across the road. Loads of musical entertainment on the streets nearby with tons of restaurants, cafes, shops, shopping, cinema, bars, within a few minutes walk. You won't get better value and quality in the centre of Barcelona. Highly recommend this hotel and I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, central location, bad breakfast, no sound-proof”
Reviews.Author: lhalep
Reviews.Content: ROOMS -Nice minimalistic interrior, excellent modern stylist, seemed brand new, cleaned very well every day! -Unfortunately very bad sound-proofing conditions, you could here every door opening and closing in your floor!! People chatting next door, the channel on their tv...and so on.. LOCATION -Central location which was excellent since there were everything at your feet. -Unfortunately the hotel location was in a dark narrow alley, with limited lighting, a little dangerous at my point of view since there is a lot of criminal activity with people asking for money and stealing (we had 2 such occurence in Spain, one of which, we had to call the police, neither of them were on the hotel alley) BREAKFAST -The breakfast area has a nice touch but the breakfast itself had limited options, the employees responsible for the breakfast were not that polite (probably because of the comments that everybody made). The quantities were also a serious issue. One hour after the breakfast was served half of the breakfast was not available. Naturaly they were repliying that if people come at the opening time, they would be enough for everyone..Something that does not make sense!! Clearly they do not had enough for everybody. I have stayed 5 days and everyday I heard people complaining. In general I would recommend this hotel as a combination of price and room condition in accordance to location. Although the hotel should review a lot of issues. It has the potential of beeing a top rated hotel. Its issues are easily resolved.

Reviews.Title: “Great surprise! fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Viajera885
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Denit Hotel with my girlfriend last week, it was a surprise for my birthday. We are visiting several cities in Spain and Barcelona is at the moment the favourite one. We couldn´t have stayed in a better hotel. It is simple, clean and stylish. Rooms are perfectly and delicately decorated, also very comfortable. Breakfast has a good choice and it´s just delicious. Staff is extremely helpful and friendly, not the kind of hypocrit people who makes an obligated smile. We really felt in home and that´s very important when you are travelling for a long time. Room service deserves also our congratulations. Room had been carefully cleaned every day. Next stay at Barcelona will be at Denit Hotel, no doubt about it!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Denit Barcelona
HotelInfo.Address: Estruc 24 - 26, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
